Enterprise User & Access Management.description: Securely manage users, workspaces, and organizations with enterprise-grade Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) and Single Sign-On (SSO) integrations.

files.description: This file contains the Chinese version of the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct, outlining expected behaviors and responsibilities for participants in the Flowise project.

This file defines core data structures, enums, and Zod validation schemas for enterprise-level user management, authentication, authorization, and organization/workspace features within the application. It serves as a central interface definition for various enterprise-specific entities and validation rules.

This file defines the `AccountService` class, which manages user accounts by handling registration, verification, and platform-specific account creation flows for users, organizations, and workspaces.

This file defines the `OrganizationService` class, which handles business logic and database operations for managing organizations, including creation, retrieval, validation, and updates. It orchestrates interactions with the database and other services like `UserService` for organization-related tasks.

This service manages organization-user relationships, including reading, querying, and potentially creating entries for users within specific organizations, often considering their roles and associated workspaces.

This file defines the WorkspaceUserService, which is responsible for managing and querying workspace user data. It provides methods for validating workspace user attributes and retrieving workspace users based on various criteria such as workspace ID, user ID, organization ID, and role ID.

This file defines the UserService, responsible for handling all user-related business logic, including validation, creation, retrieval, updating, and credential management (encryption, password changes) within the application. It interacts with the database to persist user data and manages user sessions.

This file defines the `WorkspaceService`, responsible for managing all lifecycle operations (create, read, update, delete) for workspace entities within the enterprise module. It handles complex transactional operations to ensure data integrity across numerous related database entities like chatflows, datasets, and user associations.

This file defines the `OrganizationUserController` class, which handles API requests for managing organization users. It provides endpoints for creating, reading, updating, and deleting user memberships within organizations, including specific logic for enterprise platforms.
This file defines the `UserController`, which handles API requests for user management operations such as creating, reading, and updating user data within the enterprise section of the application.

This file defines the `WorkspaceUserController` class, which handles API requests for managing workspace users. It provides methods for creating, reading, updating, and deleting workspace user records.

This file defines the `OrganizationController` class, an Express controller responsible for managing organization-related operations, including CRUD functions for organizations and handling various subscription management tasks such as seat adjustments, plan changes, and usage tracking.

This file defines the WorkspaceController, an Express.js controller responsible for handling API requests related to workspace management. It provides methods for creating, reading, updating, deleting, and switching workspaces, interacting with various services to manage workspace-related entities and user sessions.

This file provides utility functions for sending various types of emails (e.g., workspace invites, password resets, email verifications) using Nodemailer and Handlebars templates, configured via environment variables.
This file provides utility functions for extracting and validating workspace IDs from requests or direct input, formatting them for database queries using TypeORM's `Equal` operator.

This directory is designated for server-side source code handling email-related functionalities specifically tailored for enterprise deployments within the Flowise application. It centralizes logic for enterprise-level email features.

This file defines the TypeORM User entity, representing the data model for a user in the system, including their properties, status, and relationships to other entities like organizations, roles, and workspaces.
This file defines the TypeORM entity for 'OrganizationUser', representing the relationship between an organization and a user, including their assigned role, status, and creation/update metadata.
This file defines the TypeORM entity for an Organization, including its properties like ID, name, customer/subscription details, and relationships to User entities for creation and updates.
This file defines the `Workspace` TypeORM entity, modeling a workspace within the application with properties like name, description, and relationships to organizations and users.
This file defines the `WorkspaceUser` TypeORM entity, which models the relationship between a user and a workspace. It tracks the user's role and status within a specific workspace.

This file defines TypeORM entities for enterprise-level database models, including WorkspaceUsers, WorkspaceShared, and LoginActivity. It establishes the schema for managing workspace user assignments, shared items within workspaces, and user login activity records.
This TypeORM migration adds a 'workspaceId' column of type varchar(36) to the 'custom_template' table in a MySQL database, and includes a rollback function to remove it.

This file is a TypeORM migration that creates the `workspace_shared` table in a MySQL database, designed to track shared items across workspaces. It defines the table schema including `id`, `workspaceId`, `sharedItemId`, `itemType`, and timestamps.

This migration script creates a 'Personal Workspace' for each existing user in the database, associating it with an organization and the respective user. It's part of the enterprise database setup for Flowise.
This migration file defines the database schema changes to add an 'organization' table and link it to the 'workspace' table by adding an 'organizationId' column.
This file is a TypeORM migration script that adds an index and a foreign key constraint to link the `workspace` table to the `organization` table via the `organizationId` column in a MySQL database.

This file is a TypeORM database migration script designed to refactor the enterprise database schema. It involves renaming existing tables, creating new versions of core tables like user, organization, role, and workspace, and establishing new relationship tables such as organization_user and login_method.
This migration file adds new `workspace` and `workspace_users` tables and integrates workspace functionality by adding a `workspaceId` column to various existing tables in the database.
This file is a TypeORM database migration for MySQL that adds a `workspaceId` column to the `execution` table, along with an index and a foreign key constraint linking it to the `workspace` table.

This TypeORM migration file establishes foreign key relationships and creates indexes to link various application tables (e.g., apikey, user, chat_flow, tool, assistant) to a central 'workspace' table. It ensures that entities across the system are associated with a specific workspace.

This TypeORM migration script creates an 'organization' table with fields for ID, name, admin user, and timestamps, and adds an 'organizationId' column to the 'workspace' table. It supports database schema changes related to organizational structure.

This TypeORM migration script creates the 'workspace_shared' table in a PostgreSQL database, designed to store records of items shared within a workspace for an enterprise server component. It includes fields for workspace ID, shared item ID, item type, and timestamps.
This migration file adds a new 'workspaceId' column of type 'varchar' to the 'custom_template' table in the database. It also provides the corresponding 'down' method to remove this column.

This migration file adds a 'workspaceId' column to the 'execution' table, converting its type to UUID, adding a foreign key constraint to the 'workspace' table, and creating an index. It also defines the reverse operations to drop these additions.

This migration file introduces the concept of 'workspaces' into the database schema. It creates 'workspace' and 'workspace_users' tables and adds a 'workspaceId' column to various existing tables, effectively linking them to a specific workspace.

This TypeORM migration file modifies the 'workspace' table by converting the 'organizationId' column to a UUID type, adding a foreign key constraint to the 'organization' table, and creating an index on 'organizationId'.

This file is a TypeORM migration script that refactors the enterprise database schema. It involves renaming, creating, and modifying tables such as user, organization, login_method, role, and workspace-related entities, along with data migration.

This TypeORM migration creates a 'Personal Workspace' for every existing user in the system and assigns each user to their respective new workspace. It uses the first available organization ID for these new workspaces.

This migration script updates multiple database tables to use UUIDs for their workspace ID columns, adds foreign key constraints linking them to the 'workspace' table, and creates indexes on these columns. It facilitates workspace-based data partitioning and management.
This migration file creates database tables for user management, roles, and login activity, specifically for MariaDB. It defines the schema for `user`, `roles`, and `login_activity` tables.
This migration file adds a personal workspace for each existing user in the database. It associates each user with their new personal workspace and assigns a 'pw' role.
This TypeORM migration file defines the creation and deletion of the `workspace_shared` table in a MariaDB database. The table is designed to track shared items within different workspaces.
This TypeORM migration adds a 'workspaceId' column of type varchar(36) to the 'custom_template' table, enabling workspace-specific custom templates.

This TypeORM migration script introduces an 'organization' table with related columns and adds an 'organizationId' column to the 'workspace' table, indicating the implementation of organizational structuring or multi-tenancy features.

This TypeORM migration for MariaDB introduces workspace functionality by creating `workspace` and `workspace_users` tables. It also adds a `workspaceId` column to numerous existing tables, enabling multi-tenancy or workspace-specific data partitioning.

This file is a TypeORM migration script for MariaDB that adds an `organizationId` column to the `workspace` table, along with an index and a foreign key constraint linking it to the `organization` table. It establishes a relationship between workspaces and organizations.

This TypeORM migration adds a 'workspaceId' column to the 'execution' table in a MariaDB database, including an index and a foreign key constraint referencing the 'workspace' table, to support workspace-specific execution data.

This migration file adds foreign key constraints and indexes to link multiple database tables (e.g., apikey, user, chat_flow, tool, assistant, credential, etc.) to the `workspace` table using a `workspaceId` column for multi-tenancy support.

This file is a database migration script that refactors the enterprise database schema. It renames and recreates several core tables (user, organization, roles, workspace_users) to introduce new fields and relationships, and also creates new tables like login_method and organization_user.
This TypeORM migration file for SQLite creates the 'workspace_shared' table, which is used to store information about items shared within a workspace, including their IDs, types, and timestamps.

This TypeORM migration adds a 'Personal Workspace' for each existing user, associating it with the first available organization. It also assigns the user a 'pw' role within their newly created personal workspace.

This TypeORM migration script for SQLite adds an 'organization' table and an 'organizationId' column to the 'workspace' table, supporting multi-tenancy or organizational structures within the application.
This TypeORM migration script for SQLite introduces workspace functionality by creating 'workspace' and 'workspace_users' tables and adding a 'workspaceId' column to various existing tables.

This TypeORM migration file adds a 'workspaceId' column of type TEXT to the 'custom_template' table in the SQLite database schema. It includes both `up` and `down` methods for applying and reverting this schema change.
This TypeORM migration adds a `workspaceId` column and a foreign key constraint to the `execution` table for SQLite databases. It also includes an index for the new `workspaceId` column.

This TypeORM migration script for SQLite adds or updates a `workspaceId` foreign key to several database tables (ApiKey, User, Workspace Users, Chatflow, Tool, Assistant). It refactors existing tables to establish relationships with a `workspace` table.

This TypeORM migration script refactors the enterprise database schema. It renames existing tables (e.g., 'user', 'organization', 'roles', 'workspace', 'workspace_users') to temporary names and then creates new versions of these tables along with new tables like 'login_method' and 'organization_user', updating their structures and relationships.

This TypeORM migration script adds a foreign key constraint to the 'workspace' table, linking it to the 'organization' table via an 'organizationId' column. It creates a temporary table with the constraint, migrates data, drops the original table, and renames the temporary table.
This file defines an Oclif command that allows administrators to either list all user email addresses or reset a user's password in the database.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for a 'Variable' in the database, representing a configurable key-value pair with a name, value, type, and association to a workspace. It includes metadata like creation and update timestamps.
This file defines an Express controller responsible for handling API requests related to application settings, specifically retrieving a list of settings from a service.

This file provides a collection of functions for interacting with various account-related API endpoints, handling operations such as registration, verification, password management, billing, and authentication.
This file defines API functions for interacting with 'leads' resources. It provides methods to retrieve existing leads and add new ones to the system.
This file defines an API client for fetching platform settings from the backend. It exports a function to retrieve settings via a GET request to the '/settings' endpoint.

This file provides an API client for managing workspaces, including operations like creating, retrieving, updating, deleting workspaces, managing user associations, switching workspaces, and handling shared workspaces within an organization.
This file defines a set of API client functions for managing user accounts, organization-specific users and subscriptions, and workspace-specific users.

This file defines the structure and content of the Flowise dashboard's navigation menu. It specifies menu items, their URLs, associated icons, and required permissions for various features like chatflows, tools, credentials, user management, and settings.

This file defines a React component, `AllowedDomainsDialog`, which renders a Material-UI dialog to manage or display allowed domains. It utilizes Redux for state management and `createPortal` to render the dialog outside the main DOM tree.

This file defines a React component, `InviteUsersDialog`, which provides a user interface for inviting new users or managing existing users within an organization or specific workspace. It allows searching for users, assigning roles, and associating users with workspaces, utilizing Material-UI components and Redux for state management.

This file defines a React component for a dialog that allows users to share a specific item (e.g., a chatbot or flow) with different workspaces within their organization. It displays available workspaces and their current sharing status, enabling users to update the sharing permissions.

This file defines the ForgotPasswordPage component, which allows users to request password reset instructions by entering their email address. It handles the submission, displays feedback messages, and integrates with an API for the password reset functionality.

This file implements the user registration page, handling different registration flows (enterprise, cloud) with form validation and integration with various Single Sign-On (SSO) providers. It manages user input, API calls for registration, and displays success or error messages.

This file implements the React component for account settings, allowing users to manage their profile, change passwords, view subscription details and usage, and access the billing portal in a cloud environment.

This file implements the Organization and Admin User Setup page, allowing new users to register an account and an organization, or existing users to authenticate. It handles user input validation, account registration via API, and integration with SSO providers.

This file defines a React component responsible for displaying and managing a list of users. It presents user information in a table, including their roles, status, and provides functionalities like viewing assigned workspace roles, editing user details, and deleting users, with built-in role-based access control.

This React component provides a modal dialog for editing an existing user's details, specifically their account status, within an organization. It interacts with an API to update the user's information and manages the dialog's visibility and state.

This file implements a React component for a dialog that allows users to add a new workspace or edit an existing one. It handles form input, interacts with a workspace API, and manages Redux state for workspace data.

This file defines a React component that renders a dialog for editing a user's role within a specific workspace. It allows an administrator to select and assign a new role to a user from a list of available roles.

This file defines the main React component for displaying and managing workspaces. It allows users to view, edit, delete, and switch between workspaces, as well as manage users associated with each workspace.
This file is a React component that manages and displays users within a specific workspace. It provides functionality to view, invite, edit roles, and remove users from the workspace.
This Cypress E2E test file, currently commented out, is designed to verify the CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for API keys through the `/api/v1/apikey` endpoint.
This file provides utility functions for generating, hashing, and securely comparing API keys. It handles the cryptographic operations required for API key management and verification.
This file provides utility functions for validating API keys from incoming requests. It includes logic to validate API keys associated with specific chat flows and general API keys.
This file defines the TypeORM entity for an API key, outlining its structure and properties like ID, API key and secret, key name, permissions, and associated workspace.
This file defines the TypeORM entity for 'Credential', outlining the schema for storing credential details such as name, type, encrypted data, and associated workspace within the database.
This TypeORM migration file modifies the 'encryptedData' column in the 'credential' table, changing its data type from VARCHAR to TEXT.

This TypeORM migration script creates an 'apikey' table in the database, designed to store API keys, secrets, and related metadata. It includes an 'up' function for table creation and a 'down' function for table deletion.

This migration file adds a 'permissions' JSON column to the 'apikey' table, initializing it with a comprehensive set of API key permissions. It also updates existing roles to remove specific 'sso:manage' and 'apikeys:import' permissions from their permission sets.
This migration file creates the 'apikey' table in the database, including columns for API key, secret, name, and update date. It also defines the rollback operation to drop this table.

This migration adds a new 'permissions' column to the 'apikey' table, initializes it with a default set of permissions, and removes specific outdated permissions ('sso:manage', 'apikeys:import') from existing roles.
This database migration modifies the `encryptedData` column in the `credential` table, changing its data type from VARCHAR to TEXT to accommodate larger encrypted strings.

This TypeORM migration file adds a 'permissions' JSON column to the 'apikey' table, populating it with a default set of API key permissions, and removes specific permissions ('sso:manage', 'apikeys:import') from existing roles.
This file is a TypeORM migration that adds a new `apikey` table to the MySQL database, designed to store API key credentials including the key, secret, and name.

This TypeORM migration script for PostgreSQL adds an 'apikey' table to the database, including fields for ID, API key, API secret, key name, and update date. It enables the creation and management of API keys within the system.

This migration file adds a 'permissions' column to the 'apikey' table, initializing it with a default set of permissions. It also removes specific permissions like 'sso:manage' and 'apikeys:import' from existing roles.

This file defines an Express.js controller for managing API keys, including operations to retrieve, create, update, delete, and verify API keys. It handles HTTP requests, performs input validation, and interacts with an API key service.

This file implements an Express.js controller for managing credential-related API endpoints. It handles requests for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting credentials, delegating business logic to a separate service layer.
This file provides service functions for managing API keys, including creation, retrieval, updating, deleting, and validating permissions for API keys within the Flowise application.

This file defines a service for managing credential-related operations in the Flowise application. It provides functions for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting credentials, handling encrypted data, and integrating with workspace-specific sharing features.
This file contains unit tests for the API key generation utility function. It verifies that an API key can be successfully generated as a string.
This file defines a set of API client functions for managing API keys, including operations to retrieve all keys, create, update, and delete individual API keys.
This file defines API client functions for interacting with credential-related endpoints, including retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting credentials and component-specific credentials.
This React component implements a dialog for managing API keys, allowing users to create new keys or edit existing ones by defining and assigning specific permissions.

This file defines the UI component for managing API keys, including displaying a paginated list of API keys, handling their creation, editing, deletion, and showing associated chatflows and permissions.

This component serves as a generic input handler for various credential parameters, dynamically rendering different UI input types (e.g., string, boolean, JSON, dropdown) based on the input parameter's type and properties. It allows users to input and manage credential-related data in a unified way.

Manages caching for user subscription details and usage quotas retrieved from Stripe, utilizing either an in-memory cache or Redis for persistence. It provides methods to retrieve, store, and clear cached subscription and quota information.
This file contains the commercial license terms for the enterprise version of the FlowiseAI software, outlining its usage rights, restrictions, and subscription requirements for production use.

This file manages and checks usage quotas for different features (e.g., flows, users, predictions, storage) based on subscription plans. It provides functions to retrieve current usage, update usage counts, and enforce limits, throwing errors when quotas are exceeded.

This file defines an Express route handler `getPricing` which retrieves and serves a list of pricing plans for the application. It includes details such as plan features, pricing, and product IDs loaded from environment variables.

This file provides a `getSettings` function that determines and returns platform-specific settings (Enterprise, Cloud, or Open Source) based on the running Express application's identity manager and license validity. It serves as an entry point for retrieving core application configuration related to the platform.
This file defines API functions related to pricing. It exports a function to retrieve pricing plans from the '/pricing' endpoint.

This file implements a React component called `PricingDialog` which displays and manages subscription pricing plans. It allows users to view available plans, select a plan, update their subscription, and access the billing portal.

This file defines a React component that displays a license expiration message to the user. It provides information about the expired enterprise license and offers a button to contact support for renewal.

This file defines the `IdentityManager` class, which is responsible for managing the application's licensing status (Open Source, Enterprise, or Cloud) and initializing and configuring various Single Sign-On (SSO) providers based on the license and stored settings.

This file defines an Express controller responsible for managing enterprise login methods, including creation, retrieval, updating, and testing configurations for various SSO providers like Auth0, Azure, Google, and GitHub.

This file defines Express.js controller functions for handling authentication and authorization-related API endpoints. It includes logic for retrieving and filtering user permissions based on various criteria (e.g., user role, feature flags, platform type) and for processing Single Sign-On (SSO) success callbacks.

This file implements Google Single Sign-On (SSO) functionality, extending a base SSO class to handle Google OpenID Connect authentication, including login routes, callback handling, user verification, and token refreshing.

This file implements GitHub Single Sign-On (SSO) functionality for the application. It configures Passport.js with the GitHub strategy, handles the OAuth login and callback routes, and manages user authentication and token refreshing.

This file implements Auth0 as a Single Sign-On (SSO) provider, handling authentication setup, login/callback routes, and token management for the application. It integrates with `passport-auth0` to facilitate user authentication via Auth0.

This file implements Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Single Sign-On (SSO) functionality, extending a base SSO class. It configures and integrates the Azure AD OpenID Connect strategy using Passport.js for user authentication, login flow, token management, and configuration testing.

This abstract class establishes the base structure and common logic for implementing Single Sign-On (SSO) providers in the Flowise platform. It handles user verification, registration, and populates a comprehensive `LoggedInUser` object upon successful SSO authentication.

This file defines the `LoginMethod` TypeORM entity, representing a configurable login method within an enterprise application. It includes properties for method name, configuration, status, and associations with organizations and users.
This TypeORM migration script adds columns for SSO configuration, user type, and login mode to the 'organization', 'user', and 'login_activity' tables in a MySQL database.
This TypeORM migration script adds columns for Single Sign-On (SSO) configuration, user type, and login mode to the 'organization', 'user', and 'login_activity' tables respectively.

This TypeORM migration script for MariaDB adds columns related to Single Sign-On (SSO) and user type/login mode to the `organization`, `user`, and `login_activity` tables. It includes both `up` (add columns) and `down` (remove columns) methods.
This database migration script adds columns related to Single Sign-On (SSO) configuration and user/login types to the `organization`, `user`, and `login_activity` tables in a SQLite database.
This file defines API functions for managing OAuth2 credentials, including authorization, token refreshing, and handling callback redirects.
This file defines API client functions for managing login methods, including retrieving, updating, and testing login configurations for an application.
This file defines API functions related to Single Sign-On (SSO). It provides a function to initiate the SSO login process for a specified provider.

This React component handles the post-SSO (Single Sign-On) login process, extracting a token from the URL, verifying it with the backend, and redirecting the user to the dashboard upon successful authentication or to the login page on failure.

This file implements the UI and logic for configuring and managing Single Sign-On (SSO) providers such as Azure, Google, Auth0, and GitHub. It allows users to enable/disable SSO, input provider-specific credentials, validate them, and submit the configurations to the backend.

This service manages user roles within an organization, providing methods for validation, CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete) on roles, and handling their association with organizations and workspace users.
This file defines the RoleController, responsible for handling HTTP requests related to creating, reading, updating, and deleting user roles within the application.

This file defines the available permissions and their categories within the application's role-based access control (RBAC) system. It enumerates specific actions users can perform across different features like chatflows, tools, credentials, and more.
This file provides Express middleware functions for permission-based access control, allowing routes to be protected based on a user's assigned permissions or organization administrator status.

This file defines the `Role` TypeORM entity, outlining its structure, attributes (like name, permissions, and timestamps), and relationships with `Organization` and `User` entities. It also includes an enum for general role types.
This file defines a set of API calls for managing user roles within an organization, including operations to retrieve, create, update, and delete roles.

This file provides a collection of UI components (buttons, tabs, menu items) that conditionally render based on user permissions and display settings, utilizing a custom authentication hook for role-based access control (RBAC).

This component (`Available`) conditionally renders its children based on whether the authenticated user has a specified permission. It serves as a role-based access control (RBAC) wrapper for UI elements.

This file defines the UnauthorizedPage component, which displays a '403 Forbidden' message when a user attempts to access a page without sufficient permissions. It provides navigation options back to the home page or login, depending on the user's authentication status.
This file defines a React component for a dialog that allows users to create, edit, or view roles and manage their associated permissions within the application.

This file defines React components for the Flowise UI, specifically for displaying and managing user roles. It includes a drawer for viewing a role's permissions and components for displaying individual role details and actions within a table.

This service manages CRUD operations, validation, and configuration encryption for login methods within the Flowise enterprise system, handling creation, updates, and association with organizations and users.

This file defines the `AccountController` class, which handles various user account-related operations such as registration, login, password management, and logout. It acts as an API endpoint handler for managing user authentication and account settings.

This file provides utility functions for encryption and hashing, including bcrypt for password management (hashing, comparing, and checking security strength) and AES for general data encryption and decryption.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for `LoginSession`, mapping to the `login_sessions` table in the database. It stores session information, including the session ID, session content, and an optional expiration timestamp.
This TypeORM migration script creates database tables for user authentication, roles, and login activity. It defines the schema for `user`, `roles`, and `login_activity` tables.
This TypeORM migration script defines the schema for authentication-related tables, specifically creating 'user', 'roles', and 'login_activity' tables in a PostgreSQL database.
This file is a TypeORM database migration for SQLite, responsible for creating the 'user', 'roles', and 'login_activity' tables to support authentication functionalities.

This file provides utilities for initializing and managing different session persistence stores (Redis, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite) for an Express.js application, including functions to destroy all sessions for a given user.

This file configures and initializes Passport.js for authentication and session management in the application. It sets up strategies for local login and JWT, handling user authentication, session persistence, and authorization based on user roles and organization details.
This file defines a Passport.js JWT authentication strategy for Flowise, extracting the token from cookies and validating it against user data after decryption.
This TypeORM migration script modifies the 'credential' table by changing the data type of the 'encryptedData' column from VARCHAR to TEXT.
This file defines API functions for authentication and authorization, including login, resolving login states, retrieving permissions, and handling SSO success, used by the UI.

This file defines a Redux slice for managing authentication-related state, including user information, authentication status, permissions, and features. It provides reducers to handle login, logout, workspace switching, profile updates, and more, persisting some data in local storage.

This React hook (`useAuth`) provides functions to check user authentication status, permissions, features, and workspace assignments within the application, integrating with Redux state and application configuration.

This file defines a Zod schema for password validation, enforcing criteria like minimum length, presence of lowercase, uppercase, digits, and special characters. It also provides a utility function to validate a password against these rules and return any error messages.

This file provides utility functions for managing user authentication status, user data, and related information (permissions, features) within an application's local storage and cookies. It includes functionalities for retrieving, updating, and removing the current user, as well as clearing authentication-related cookies.

This file defines a React component, `ResolveLoginPage`, responsible for initiating an authentication resolution process upon page load. It uses an API call to determine the login status and redirects the user to a specified URL based on the API response.

This file defines a React component for email verification. It extracts a token from the URL, sends it to the backend for verification, and displays success, error, or loading states before redirecting the user to the sign-in page upon successful verification.

This file implements the UI and logic for a password reset page, allowing users to reset their password using an email, a provided token, and a new password. It includes form validation, API interaction for password reset, and user feedback.

This file implements the sign-in page for the application, handling user authentication via username/password and integrating with various Single Sign-On (SSO) providers like Google, Azure, GitHub, and Auth0. It manages authentication state, errors, and success redirection.

This file provides service functions for managing user login activities within an enterprise context, including recording new login events and fetching a paginated list of historical login activities with filtering capabilities.
This file defines an Express controller for fetching login activity. It handles incoming requests, calls an audit service to retrieve login data, and sends the response.

This file provides utility functions for sanitizing data, including recursively removing null byte characters from string values within objects/arrays and stripping sensitive fields from user objects.
This file defines an API client function to fetch login activity data for auditing purposes. It uses a shared 'client' instance to make a POST request to the '/audit/login-activity' endpoint.

This file defines a React UI component named `Security` that aggregates and displays various security-related configurations, such as rate limiting, allowed domains, and override settings, likely within a dialog or settings panel.

This file defines a React component for displaying a '429 Too Many Requests' error page. It informs the user they have been rate-limited, provides a retry timeframe, and offers a link back to the home page.
This React component displays a user's login and logout activity, providing filtering options by date range and activity type. It fetches audit data from an API and renders it in a paginated table.
This file is the Japanese localization of the Flowise project's README, providing information on installation, usage, development, deployment, and support in Japanese.

This file is the Korean localization of the Flowise project's README, providing instructions and information in Korean. It includes quick start guides, Docker usage, developer guides, environment variables, documentation links, self-hosting options, and contribution guidelines.
This file is the Traditional Chinese () localized README for the Flowise project, providing an overview, installation instructions, developer setup, deployment options, and contribution guidelines.

This file is a Chinese-language guide for contributors to the Flowise project, outlining various ways to contribute, including code, documentation, bug reports, ideas, and community engagement. It provides detailed instructions for setting up a development environment and submitting pull requests.
This file is the Simplified Chinese README for the Flowise project, providing an overview, quick start guide, Docker instructions, developer setup, documentation, and deployment options.

This file serves as the main entry point for the 'components' package, consolidating and re-exporting various modules, interfaces, and utilities for easier access within the Flowise application. It also initializes environment variables using dotenv.
This Gulpfile automates the process of copying icon files (JPG, PNG, SVG) from various 'nodes' subdirectories to the 'dist/nodes' directory within the Flowise components package.
This file configures Jest for running tests in a TypeScript project, specifying settings like the test environment, root directories for test files, and how to transform TypeScript files for testing.
This file sets up an Express server to host and display Flowise API documentation using Swagger UI. It serves the documentation at the '/api-docs' endpoint and redirects the root URL to it.

This directory is intended to store YAML files that define or contribute to the API documentation for the Flowise project. It serves as a source for structured documentation definitions within the `api-documentation` package.

This file configures and generates the OpenAPI (Swagger) documentation for the Flowise API. It defines API metadata, server information, and specifies the source files for API definitions, then exports the generated documentation and UI options.

This is the Chinese-language README file for Flowise, providing a quick start guide, environmental variables, documentation links, deployment options, and community support information for the AI agent builder.
This file is the configuration for Cypress end-to-end (e2e) tests within the project. It defines settings and event listeners for running Cypress tests.

This README file serves as the main documentation for the Flowise server package, providing instructions for installation, quick start, configuration via environment variables, testing, and various self-hosting options.
This Babel configuration file extends a common parent configuration located two directories up, ensuring consistent transpilation settings across the project.
This file is the Jest configuration for the Flowise server package, specifying settings for testing TypeScript files with 'ts-jest' in a Node.js environment.
This Gulpfile defines a task to copy Handlebars (.hbs) email template files from the source directory to the distribution directory. It ensures that email templates are part of the build output.

This `bin` directory within the server package is typically reserved for executable scripts or compiled binaries. It would likely contain startup scripts, utility scripts, or the main server executable for the Flowise application, facilitating direct execution of server-related operations.
This file defines custom Cypress commands and potentially overwrites existing ones, as per Cypress best practices for test automation support.
This file is a Cypress support file for end-to-end tests, used for global configuration and automatically loaded before test files. It imports custom Cypress commands from './commands'.

This file defines application-wide configuration settings, such as enabling or disabling community nodes based on environment variables. It serves as a central place for managing various app configurations.

This file initializes and manages the application's database connection (TypeORM DataSource), supporting various database types like SQLite, MySQL, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL based on environment configurations.
This file defines the main 'App' class responsible for initializing and configuring the Flowise backend server, including database, middleware, authentication, and various application services.

Defines a custom error class, `InternalFlowiseError`, used for internal errors within the Flowise application. This class extends the standard `Error` and includes a `statusCode` property to provide specific HTTP status information.
This file provides a utility function for SQLite database migrations, specifically to check if a column exists in a table and add it if it doesn't.
This file defines the 'Start' command for the Flowise application. It handles the initialization of data sources, starting the server, and managing graceful shutdown or error handling.

This file defines the `BaseCommand` abstract class for oclif commands in Flowise. It handles environment variable loading, defines numerous configurable flags for various application settings, and sets up common process event handlers.
This file handles loading and managing configuration settings for the application, primarily focusing on logging configurations, by reading from environment variables or providing default values.

This file exports a utility function `getRunningExpressApp` which safely retrieves a singleton Express application instance, ensuring it is properly initialized with required components like `nodesPool` and `telemetry`.

This file imports the TypeORM DataSource and exports a pre-configured DataSource instance obtained from a local helper function. It serves as a central point for accessing the application's TypeORM data source.

This file defines various constants and enums used across the application, including API route whitelists/blacklists, general error and success messages, document storage paths, and input parameter types.

This file defines an abstract `BaseQueue` class using BullMQ for managing job queues. It provides core functionalities for adding jobs, creating workers to process jobs, and managing queue events and cleanup, with abstract methods for specific job processing logic.

This file defines the `QueueManager` class, a singleton responsible for initializing, registering, and managing different types of BullMQ queues (prediction and upsertion) using Redis. It also integrates with BullBoard for queue monitoring and provides methods to access queue-related functionalities.
This file defines a Redis event subscriber that listens to specific channels. It receives event messages from Redis and streams them to clients using Server-Sent Events (SSE).
This TypeORM migration modifies the `executionData` column in the `execution` table, changing its type from `TEXT` to `LONGTEXT` to accommodate larger data, specifically for MariaDB.
This file serves as an index for MariaDB database migrations, importing and listing all individual migration scripts that define schema changes and data modifications for the application's database.

This TypeORM migration script defines the initial database schema for the application. It creates tables such as `chat_flow`, `chat_message`, `credential`, and `tool` along with their respective columns and indexes.
This file defines and exports an array of SQLite database migration classes. It serves as an index for applying schema changes to the SQLite database within the application.
This TypeORM migration file modifies the `executionData` column in the `execution` table from `TEXT` to `LONGTEXT` in a MySQL database, allowing for larger data storage in that column.

This file serves as an index for MySQL database migrations, importing and exporting a sequential list of migration scripts that define schema changes and data modifications for the application's database.

This TypeORM migration file defines the schema and creates a 'variable' table in a PostgreSQL database, including columns for ID, name, value, type, and timestamps. It also provides a rollback mechanism to drop the table.

This database migration file modifies the data type of the 'sessionId' column in the 'execution' table from UUID to VARCHAR. It provides an 'up' function for the change and a 'down' function to revert it.

This file defines and exports an array of PostgreSQL database migration classes. It aggregates individual migration scripts to be applied to the database, including both core and enterprise-specific migrations.
This file defines a simple ping endpoint for health checks. It responds with 'pong' when accessed.

This file defines an Express controller for handling API requests related to application versions. It provides a `getVersion` function that retrieves version information using a dedicated service and sends it as a JSON response.
This file provides a service to retrieve the application's version by locating and parsing the `package.json` file in parent directories. It exports a function `getVersion` for this purpose.

This file defines an Express error handling middleware that catches `InternalFlowiseError`s, formats the error response (including status code and message), and sends it as JSON. It also adjusts specific error messages and conditionally includes the stack trace based on the environment.
This file serves as the main entry point for running integration tests for the Flowise server. It sets up and tears down the server environment before executing various route and utility test suites.
This `craco` configuration file customizes Webpack settings for a Create React App project, specifically adjusting JavaScript module resolution and ignoring certain source map warnings.
This file provides the Chinese documentation (README) for the Flowise React frontend UI package. It describes its purpose, installation instructions, and licensing.

This file configures Vite for the React user interface, setting up plugins, path aliases for shared monorepo dependencies, build output, and a development server with dynamic proxying to a backend server.

This file contains the logic for registering, updating, and unregistering a service worker for a web application. It enables offline capabilities and faster loading times by caching assets, while also handling development environments like localhost.
This file defines global configuration settings for the Flowise UI, including base paths, default routes, font family, and styling properties like border radius.

This file serves as the main entry point for a React application, responsible for rendering the root 'App' component and setting up global providers for state management (Redux), routing, notifications, and various custom contexts.
This file initializes and exports the main Redux store for the UI package, using a reducer imported from './reducer'.

This file establishes a React Context to manage and provide global configuration and platform license information (enterprise, cloud, or open-source) to components throughout the application. It fetches platform settings on mount and makes them accessible via the `useConfig` hook.

This file sets up a simple Express.js server to provide a health check endpoint (`/healthz`) for a worker service. It listens on a specified port and responds with 'OK' to indicate the service is running.

This README details the purpose and setup of the Flowise worker, which enables horizontal scaling for Flowise instances operating in queue mode. It explains the worker's interaction with a message broker and provides instructions for configuring both the main Flowise server and the worker.

This README.md provides instructions for deploying and configuring Flowise using Docker. It covers basic usage with a Docker Hub image, environmental variables for data persistence, and setting up Flowise in queue mode using specific docker-compose files.
This file provides utility functions for robust error handling, specifically to safely extract a string message from an unknown error type.

This file implements secure HTTP request utilities (for Axios and node-fetch) that prevent Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) by validating URLs against a configurable deny list of IP addresses/CIDR ranges, including during redirects. It resolves hostnames to IPs and checks them against the deny list, throwing an error if a denied IP is encountered.

This file provides a collection of utility functions for validating various data types, including UUIDs, URLs, and importantly, file paths, filenames, and MIME types. It primarily focuses on security validations to prevent issues like path traversal and MIME type spoofing.
Provides a `SecureZodSchemaParser` class that safely parses Zod schema strings into Zod schema objects, preventing arbitrary code execution by restricting allowed types and operations.
This file defines the `AbortControllerPool` class, which manages and tracks `AbortController` instances, allowing them to be added, retrieved, and aborted by a unique identifier.
This file provides utility functions for robustly extracting a string message from various error types, ensuring a consistent `message` property is available for error reporting.

This file provides utility functions for validating common data types and formats such as UUIDs, emails, names, date-times, and passwords. It includes functions to check for invalid inputs and a specific function to validate passwords with detailed error messages.

This file contains a utility function for MySQL database migrations. It provides a function `ensureColumnExists` to check if a specified column exists in a table and adds it if not, ensuring schema consistency.
This file provides a utility function, `ensureColumnExists`, to check if a specific column exists in a MariaDB table and add it if it does not, facilitating database schema migrations.
This utility file provides a function to check if a specific column exists within a given database table using TypeORM's QueryRunner.
This file defines a utility function to extract and validate `page` and `limit` query parameters from an Express request for pagination purposes.

This file provides a utility function to validate that a file's extension matches its declared MIME type, wrapping an external validation with consistent error handling to prevent MIME type spoofing attacks.
This file defines a React ErrorBoundary component that displays a user-friendly error message, including status and details from an API response, and provides options to copy the error or seek help.
Configures and exports an Axios HTTP client for API requests, including an interceptor to handle authentication errors and refresh expired tokens.

This file provides a React context provider (`ConfirmContextProvider`) that manages the state and dispatch for a confirmation/alert dialog using `useReducer` and `ConfirmContext`. It makes the dialog's state and actions available to its child components.

This file defines and exports a React Context named `ConfirmContext`. It is used to provide a mechanism for managing and sharing confirmation-related state or functions across React components in the Flowise UI.

This file defines a React context for global error handling, providing a centralized function to manage and react to different HTTP error statuses like unauthorized access, rate limiting, and invalid tokens, often involving user redirection or state updates.

This file defines a custom React hook named `useApi` that encapsulates asynchronous API calls, managing loading, data, and error states. It also integrates with a global error context for consistent error handling across the application.
This file defines a React hook `useSearchShortcut` that enables keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+F/Ctrl+F to focus, Escape to blur) for a search input field, adapting to different operating systems.
This file defines a `useScriptRef` React hook that provides a mutable ref object to track if a component is still mounted, preventing operations on unmounted components.

This file defines the `useConfirm` React hook, which provides functionality to display and manage a global confirmation dialog. It uses a context to control the dialog's visibility and handles user interactions (confirm/cancel) with a Promise-based resolution.
This file provides custom React hooks, `useBlocker` and `usePrompt`, to prevent navigation within a React Router application until a user confirms an action, typically via a browser prompt.
This file provides utility functions for robust error handling, primarily focused on reliably extracting a string message from various error types or non-error inputs.

This file defines a custom React hook, `useNotifier`, that integrates Redux with the `notistack` library to manage and display application-wide snackbar notifications. It ensures notifications are properly enqueued, dismissed, and removed from the Redux store state.

This file defines a reusable React component, `AnimateButton`, which provides various motion animations (scale, slide, rotate) to its children using `framer-motion`, customizable via props like type, direction, and scale.
This file defines styled Material-UI components, `StyledButton` and `StyledToggleButton`, to customize their appearance, including color and hover effects, based on the theme palette.
This file defines a React component for a customizable 'Copy to Clipboard' button, utilizing Material-UI and Redux for state management, including disabled and loading states.

This file defines a reusable Material-UI `MainCard` component, providing a customizable card wrapper with options for title, secondary actions, content rendering, and styling, suitable for various UI sections.

This file defines a reusable React UI component called `StatsCard` that displays a title and a statistic, with styling dynamically adjusted based on Redux-managed customization settings (e.g., dark mode, border radius).

This file defines a reusable React `CheckboxInput` component using Material-UI, providing a labeled checkbox with state management and an onChange handler. It serves as a UI component for interactive boolean input within the application.
This file defines a React component that displays a Material-UI dialog containing markdown-formatted content, typically used for input hints or descriptions.
This file defines a reusable React component for a global confirmation dialog. It displays a customizable title, description, and action buttons, rendered as a portal.

This file defines a React component, `SourceDocDialog`, which renders a modal dialog to display source document data or error messages to the user. It uses `ReactJson` to present the data in a formatted JSON view.

This file defines a reusable React component named `Transitions` that acts as a wrapper for various Material-UI transition effects (Grow, Collapse, Fade, Slide, Zoom). It allows applying different animation types and origin positions to its children.

This file defines a reusable `Breadcrumbs` React component. It dynamically generates navigation breadcrumbs based on the current URL and a provided navigation structure, offering various display customization options.

This file defines the `SettingsSection` React component, which provides a structured layout for displaying sections within a settings or configuration interface. It includes areas for a title, child components, and an optional action.

This file defines the `MultiDropdown` React component, which is a reusable Material-UI multi-select dropdown field. It handles multiple selections, converts them to and from a JSON string format, and applies custom styling.
This file defines a reusable Material-UI Autocomplete-based dropdown component. It supports displaying options with images and descriptions, handles selection, and allows for custom styling.
This file defines a React component (`Loader`) that provides a global linear loading indicator using Material-UI's `LinearProgress` component, typically displayed at the top of the screen.

This file defines a higher-order component (HOC) called `Loadable` that wraps a given React component with `Suspense`. It displays a `Loader` component as a fallback, primarily used for lazy loading components.
This file defines a React component called `BackdropLoader` that displays a full-screen loading spinner with a backdrop. It is used to visually indicate an ongoing process by overlaying the UI.

This file defines a React component, `InputSlider`, which provides a customizable Material-UI slider synchronized with an input field for numerical value selection. It includes custom styling for the slider's appearance.

This file defines the `TabPanel` React component, which is used to render content associated with a specific tab in a tabbed interface. It conditionally displays its children only when its `value` prop matches its `index` prop.
Defines a palette of blue color shades with hex codes, intended for use in UI components like tabs.
This file defines a styled MUI TabsList component, customizing its appearance with specific dimensions, colors, spacing, layout, and shadow effects based on the theme.

Defines a styled UI tab component using MUI's `BaseTab` and custom CSS, providing specific styling for various states like hover, focus, selected, and disabled. It integrates a blue color palette for its visual appearance.

This file defines a customizable React component that wraps MUI's DataGrid, providing functionalities for displaying, adding, editing, and deleting tabular data rows, with integrated styling and state management.
This file defines a React component (`CodeBlock`) for displaying syntax-highlighted code, providing functionality to copy the code to the clipboard and download it as a file.
This file defines a reusable React component named `SwitchInput` that renders a Material-UI Switch with an optional label. It provides controlled state management for the switch's checked status.

This component provides a Material-UI Tooltip that can render HTML content within its title using an HTML parser, typically displaying an info icon. It dynamically adjusts the icon's color based on the application's dark mode setting.
This file defines a React component `MoreItemsTooltip` that displays a Material-UI tooltip. The tooltip lists multiple items (specifically, image labels) when hovering over its children.
This file defines custom Material-UI styles for table cells and table rows, including styling for borders, text color, font size, and row height, to be used within the Flowise UI package.

This file defines a read-only Material-UI table component (`TableViewOnly`) for displaying data. It includes custom rendering logic for specific column types like 'enabled' states and structured schema information with tooltips.

This file defines a reusable React component for table pagination, allowing users to navigate through data pages and adjust the number of items displayed per page. It integrates with Material-UI components for its visual presentation and state management.
This file defines a React component (`JSONViewer`) that displays and syntax-highlights JSON data. It parses a given JSON object into styled elements, supporting dark mode for color adjustments.

AI Model & Service Integration.description: Seamlessly connect to and switch between a wide range of third-party large language models (LLMs), embedding providers, and other AI services like text-to-speech.

files.description: This file provides utility functions and constants for handling AWS regions and retrieving AWS credentials from node data. It includes a list of AWS regions, a default region, an interface for AWS credentials, and a function to extract and validate AWS access keys and secrets.

This file provides utility functions to build Google authentication options, specifically for Vertex AI, from provided credential data. It handles constructing the authentication object using either a credential file path or a JSON object, and includes project ID support.

This file defines the credential schema for connecting to Azure Cognitive Services within the Flowise application, specifying necessary parameters like subscription key, service region, and API version.

This file defines a credential class for integrating Azure OpenAI API services within the Flowise platform. It specifies the necessary input parameters like API key, instance name, deployment name, and API version required for authentication.

This file defines a credential class for the Anthropic API, allowing users to securely store and manage their Anthropic API key within the Flowise application. It specifies the input parameter for the API key.
This file defines the configuration for an Eleven Labs API credential, specifying its label, name, version, and the input field required for the API key within the Flowise platform.
This file defines the DeepseekAI API credential class for Flowise, specifying the input field for the DeepseekAI API Key. It enables secure storage and usage of the API key within Flowise workflows.
Defines the Comet API credential structure and input parameters for authentication within the Flowise component system. It specifies that a 'Comet API Key' is required as a password type input.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to the Azure AI Foundry API, specifically for reranking services, by providing inputs for the API key and endpoint.
This file defines the credential class for integrating with the Cohere API. It specifies the input required for authentication, which is the Cohere API Key.

This file defines a credential class for Google Vertex AI authentication, specifying the input parameters required to configure Google application credentials, such as file paths, JSON objects, and project IDs.

This file defines the `BaiduQianfanApi` credential class, specifying the required input fields (access key and secret key) for authenticating with the Baidu Qianfan API. It serves as a credential provider within the application's ecosystem.
This file defines a credential class for authenticating with the Cerebras API. It provides a mechanism to securely input and manage a Cerebras API key within the system.

Defines the Fireworks API credential class for Flowise, specifying its label, name, version, and the required API key input parameter. This file standardizes how Fireworks API credentials are configured and managed within the Flowise application.

This file defines a credential class for the AssemblyAI API, allowing users to securely input their API key within the system. It implements the INodeCredential interface to provide authentication details.
This file defines the E2B API credential class for Flowise. It specifies the input parameters, including an E2B API key, required to configure this credential within the application.
This file defines the `GroqApi` credential class for authenticating with the Groq API within the Flowise platform. It specifies the input parameters required to configure a Groq API key.
This file defines a credential class for integrating with the Litellm API, specifically for storing and managing the API key required for authentication.
This file defines the credential configuration for the HuggingFace API within the Flowise platform. It specifies how to securely store and access the HuggingFace API key.

This file defines a credential class for authenticating with ElasticSearch using a username, password, and an optional Cloud ID or server URL. It specifies the input parameters required for these credentials.
Defines a credential class for LocalAI API access within the Flowise platform, specifying its label, name, version, and requiring an API key as input.

This file defines the credential class for integrating with IBM Watsonx services in Flowise, specifying the required input fields like service URL, project ID, and authentication methods (IAM or Bearer Token).
This file defines an HTTP Bearer Token credential class for a node-based application, specifying the structure and input (a password type token) required for such a credential.
This file defines the credential class for accessing the Ollama API within the Flowise system, specifically for handling the Ollama API key.
This file defines the credential class for integrating the JinaAI API. It specifies the input field for the JinaAI API key within the Flowise platform.
This file defines the Google MakerSuite credential class, specifying how to securely store and handle the Google MakerSuite API key within the application.
This file defines the Google Generative AI credential class for the Flowise platform, specifying its label, name, version, description, and the required input field for the API key.
This file defines the Phoenix API credential class for Flowise, specifying the required input fields like API key and endpoint for authenticating with the Phoenix API.

This file defines the Replicate API credential for Flowise components. It specifies the input field for the Replicate API Key, enabling secure authentication for Replicate-related operations within Flowise.

This file defines a credential class for handling HTTP API keys within the Flowise framework. It specifies the structure for storing an API key, including a label, name, and input fields for the key itself and its associated secret value.
This file defines a credential class for integrating the Perplexity API within the system. It handles the secure input and storage of the Perplexity API key.
This file defines a credential type for connecting to a Redis instance using a URL, specifying the input parameters required for establishing the connection.

This file defines a credential class for the TogetherAI API, enabling the storage and management of the TogetherAI API Key within the application. It specifies the input field for the API key as a password type.
This file defines a credential class for authenticating with the MistralAI API. It specifies the API key as the required input for connecting to MistralAI services.
This file defines the Xai API credential for Flowise, specifying how to securely store and use an X AI API key within the system.
This file defines a credential class for authenticating with the NVIDIA NGC API. It specifies the input field for users to provide their NVIDIA NGC API Key.
This file defines the credential class for integrating Sambanova API into Flowise components. It specifically handles the secure input of a Sambanova API key.
This file defines the credential structure for connecting to the Voyage AI API, including an API key and endpoint configuration for authentication within the Flowise platform.
This file defines the credential class for the OpenAI API within the Flowise system. It specifies the input required for authenticating with the OpenAI API, which is an API key.

This file defines the Unstructured API credential for Flowise, specifying its label, name, version, and the input field for the API key. It allows Flowise components to securely utilize the Unstructured API.
This file defines the `OpikApi` credential class, specifying the input parameters (API Key, URL, Workspace) required to configure Opik API credentials within the Flowise application.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to the Upstash Redis API, specifying the required input fields like the Redis REST URL and an authentication token.
This README file describes the Flowise Components package, which provides nodes and credentials for integrating applications with Flowise. It also includes installation instructions for the package.

This file defines Express.js controller functions responsible for handling API requests related to component credentials, such as retrieving all credentials, fetching a specific credential by name, and serving a credential's icon.

This file defines a React component, `CredentialListDialog`, which renders a modal dialog for displaying, searching, and selecting credentials. It presents a list of credentials, allows users to filter them via a search input, and handles credential selection.
This file defines a React component that provides a dialog for adding, editing, and managing credentials, including interaction with credential and OAuth2 APIs, and handling user notifications.

This file provides functionalities for converting text to speech using various providers like OpenAI and Eleven Labs, including stream processing with rate limiting. It also includes methods to retrieve available voices for these text-to-speech services.

This file defines a utility function `convertSpeechToText` that serves as a centralized gateway for transcribing audio files into text using various third-party speech-to-text providers such as OpenAI Whisper, AssemblyAI, LocalAI, Azure Cognitive Services, and Groq Whisper.

This file defines a Flowise node (component) that integrates with the AssemblyAI service to provide speech-to-text functionality. It configures the necessary properties and credentials for using AssemblyAI within a Flowise workflow.

This TypeORM migration adds a 'speechToText' column of type TEXT to the 'chat_flow' table, ensuring it's only added if it doesn't already exist. It also defines the rollback operation to remove this column.
This TypeORM migration adds a 'textToSpeech' column of type TEXT to the 'chat_flow' table in a MariaDB database. It includes a check to ensure the column is only added if it doesn't already exist.
This migration script adds a 'textToSpeech' column to the 'chat_flow' table in a MariaDB database, designed to store text-to-speech configurations for chat flows.
This TypeORM migration script adds a 'speechToText' column to the 'chat_flow' table and defines the corresponding rollback operation to remove it.

This TypeORM migration file adds a new 'textToSpeech' column of type TEXT to the 'chat_flow' table, facilitating text-to-speech functionality within chat flows. It also defines the rollback operation to remove this column.
This migration file adds a 'textToSpeech' column to the 'chat_flow' table in the SQLite database to support text-to-speech functionality for chat flows.

This TypeORM migration adds a 'textToSpeech' column to the 'chat_flow' table to support text-to-speech functionality in chat flows. It also provides the corresponding 'down' migration to remove this column.

This TypeORM migration file adds a new 'speechToText' column to the 'chat_flow' table in the database. It includes logic to add the column during the 'up' migration and remove it during the 'down' migration.
This file is a TypeORM database migration for MySQL that adds a 'textToSpeech' TEXT column to the 'chat_flow' table. It supports both applying and reverting this schema change.

This TypeORM migration file adds a new 'speechToText' column of type TEXT to the 'chat_flow' table in a PostgreSQL database. It includes both 'up' and 'down' methods for applying and reverting the schema change.
This migration file adds a 'textToSpeech' column to the 'chat_flow' table in a PostgreSQL database. It allows for the integration of text-to-speech functionality within chat flows.

This database migration file adds a new 'textToSpeech' column to the 'chat_flow' table, enabling text-to-speech functionality for chat flows. It also defines the rollback operation to remove this column.

This file defines Express.js controllers for Text-to-Speech (TTS) functionalities, handling requests to generate and stream TTS audio, abort ongoing TTS processes, and retrieve available voices from TTS providers.
This file defines interfaces and an enum for text-to-speech services, and provides a function to retrieve available voices from specified text-to-speech providers using credentials.
This file provides API client functions for interacting with Text-to-Speech (TTS) endpoints, including generating voice, listing available voices, and aborting TTS processes.
This file defines a React component for a modal dialog that encapsulates speech-to-text functionality, managing its visibility through Redux actions and rendering it via a React Portal.

This file implements a UI component for configuring and testing text-to-speech services (e.g., OpenAI, Eleven Labs) within the Flowise application. It allows users to select a provider, manage credentials, choose voices, and generate test audio.

This file implements a React UI component for configuring and managing various speech-to-text service providers, such as OpenAI Whisper, Assembly AI, and Azure Cognitive Services, within an application. It allows users to select a provider and define its specific input parameters.

This file provides utility functions for handling multi-modal inputs, primarily focusing on processing and preparing image uploads for LLMs that support vision. It includes functions to filter image/audio uploads and convert image sources into message content format.

This file provides a utility function to generate structured follow-up prompts or questions using various Large Language Model (LLM) providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Generative AI, MistralAI, Groq, and Ollama, based on a given API message content and configuration.

This file defines a Flowise node component, `LLMChain_Chains`, which encapsulates the Langchain `LLMChain` to execute queries against Language Models (LLMs). It handles various configurations such as prompt templating, output parsing, input moderation, and multi-modal inputs, providing both direct chain output and predicted responses with streaming capabilities.
This README provides documentation for the Azure OpenAI Chat Model integration within Flowise, detailing its purpose and listing required environment variables for configuration.
This file defines a custom `AzureChatOpenAI` class for Flowise, extending Langchain's Azure OpenAI model to include Flowise-specific configurations, multi-modal options, and built-in tool management.

This file defines a Flowise node component for integrating and configuring Azure OpenAI chat models. It acts as a wrapper around the Langchain AzureChatOpenAI, providing parameters and credentials for its use within the Flowise platform.

This file defines a Flowise node (`ChatAlibabaTongyi_ChatModels`) that integrates the Alibaba Tongyi chat model. It allows users to configure and utilize Alibaba Tongyi's chat capabilities within a Flowise workflow, including API key, model name, temperature, and streaming options.

This file defines the `ChatFireworks` class, an integration for the Fireworks AI chat model within the Langchain framework, handling API key management and specific request parameter adjustments for Fireworks' API.

This file defines a Flowise node (`ChatFireworks_ChatModels`) which acts as a wrapper for interacting with Fireworks AI chat model endpoints. It allows users to configure and integrate Fireworks chat models within a Flowise workflow.

This file defines a custom Flowise ChatOllama class, extending Langchain's Ollama chat model. It adds support for multimodal input and vision capabilities, along with managing model configuration within the Flowise application.

This file defines a Flowise component (`INode`) for integrating with Ollama to perform chat completions. It configures various parameters for the Ollama chat model, such as model name, temperature, streaming, and other advanced settings.

This file defines a Flowise node (`ChatCometAPI_ChatModels`) that acts as a wrapper for CometAPI's chat models, integrating them into Flowise by extending Langchain's ChatOpenAI and redirecting API calls to CometAPI's endpoint.
This file documents the parameters and an example API request for the ChatNemoGuardrails component, illustrating how to configure and use it for chat completions.

This file defines a client (`NemoClient`) for interacting with a chat completion API, likely part of a 'Nemo' guardrails system. It handles formatting messages from Langchain's `BaseMessage` into the API's required structure and sending HTTP requests.

This file defines a custom AWS Bedrock chat model component for Flowise, extending Langchain's ChatBedrockConverse. It adds multimodal capabilities, specifically handling vision tasks and dynamic model switching for image processing.

This file defines the configuration and UI components for managing follow-up prompt generation using various AI model providers, specifying their input parameters and default settings.

This file is responsible for loading and managing AI model configurations from either remote URLs or local files, providing functions to retrieve specific models, providers, and regions based on predefined categories.
