This file defines a Flowise node, `Refine_LlamaIndex`, which implements a response synthesizer using the LlamaIndex 'Refine' strategy to iteratively refine answers. It is designed to generate more detailed responses by processing text chunks sequentially, but this LlamaIndex integration is marked as deprecated.

This file defines a Flowise node wrapper for LlamaIndex's SimpleChatEngine, enabling basic conversational AI with memory and streaming capabilities. It facilitates handling back-and-forth conversations within the Flowise platform, although its LlamaIndex integration is deprecated.

This file implements a Flowise node component, `ContextChatEngine_LlamaIndex`, which integrates LlamaIndex's ContextChatEngine. Its purpose is to provide a conversational agent that answers user questions by retrieving information from documents and maintaining chat history.

This file defines a CohereRerank class that integrates with the Cohere Rerank API. It's used to re-rank a list of documents based on a query, enhancing their relevance before retrieval.

This file defines services for managing AI assistants within the Flowise platform, including creating, updating, and deleting assistants, and integrating with OpenAI's assistant API and Flowise's database entities like Assistants and Credentials.

Observability & Analytics Integration.description: Integrate with leading AI observability platforms like LangSmith and LangFuse to monitor, trace, and analyze the behavior and performance of chatflows in real-time.

files.description: This file contains unit tests for the `getPhoenixTracer` function, specifically verifying that it correctly constructs OpenTelemetry exporter URLs and headers based on various base URL inputs for Phoenix Tracing.

This file defines a `MetricsLogger` class that extends Langchain's `BaseTracer` to provide detailed logging of execution events (chains, LLMs, tools, agents) using Winston, including input, output, errors, and execution times. It's used for tracing and debugging Langchain applications.

This file defines custom callback handlers and OpenTelemetry tracers for integrating Langchain applications with various observability platforms like Langsmith, Langfuse, Lunary, Arize, Phoenix, and Opik. It facilitates logging, tracing, and monitoring of LLM operations and application runs.
This file defines the Arize API credential class for Flowise, specifying the required input fields like API Key, Space ID, and Endpoint for authentication.

This file defines the configuration for a LangWatch API credential, specifying inputs like the API key and endpoint required for integration. It serves as a credential class within a larger system, likely for a tool like Flowise.
This file defines the Langsmith API credential class, specifying the input parameters required for users to provide their Langsmith API key and endpoint within the Flowise platform.
This file defines the credential class for Lunary AI API, specifying the required inputs like Public Key/Project ID and Endpoint for integration within the Flowise platform.
This file defines the Langfuse API credential class for Flowise, specifying the required input fields like secret key, public key, and endpoint for Langfuse API integration.
Defines the Arize analytic node for the Flowise platform, enabling integration with the Arize API for analytics.
This file defines the LangWatch analytic node component for Flowise, specifying its properties, type, and credential requirements.
This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with LangFuse, enabling analytical capabilities within a Flowise workflow. It sets up the node's properties and required credentials for API access.

Defines a LangSmith analytic node for a workflow or component-based system, enabling integration with the LangSmith API for monitoring and evaluation. It sets up the node's properties, including its name, category, and required credentials.
This file defines a Lunary analytic node component, likely for a workflow automation or AI application like Flowise. It outlines the node's properties, type, category, and required API credentials.
This file defines a Flowise node that integrates with Langfuse to fetch and utilize prompt templates for Large Language Models (LLMs).
This file contains a utility function to update existing chat message feedback in the database. It also conditionally sends the updated feedback to the Lunary analytics service.
This migration file adds an 'analytic' column of type TEXT to the 'chat_flow' table in a MariaDB database, or removes it when rolled back.
This TypeORM migration adds an 'analytic' TEXT column to the 'chat_flow' table, if it doesn't already exist, and provides a method to reverse this change.

This React component provides a user interface for configuring and managing various analytics tracking integrations (e.g., LangSmith, LangFuse, Lunary) for a specific chatflow. It allows users to enable/disable providers and input their respective credentials and project settings.

This file defines interfaces and enums for a metrics reporting system within the Flowise application. It specifies the contract for a metrics provider and enumerates the various events that can be tracked as metrics.

This file initializes Prometheus monitoring for an Express.js application, setting up custom metrics like request counts, prediction totals, and HTTP request durations, and exposing them via an '/api/v1/metrics' endpoint.

This file sets up and configures a comprehensive logging system using Winston for an Express application, supporting local files, AWS S3, and Google Cloud Storage as log destinations. It also includes middleware for logging incoming HTTP requests with sensitive data sanitization.

This file defines a `Telemetry` class responsible for sending analytics data to PostHog, tracking application events like user and organization creation. It incorporates the application version and generates distinct IDs for tracking.

This file implements a Prometheus metrics provider for the Flowise application. It initializes and exposes various application metrics, including custom counters, gauges, and HTTP request statistics, via a /api/v1/metrics endpoint.

This file implements OpenTelemetry for metric collection within the Flowise server. It initializes and manages various counters and histograms, including HTTP request metrics, and exports them via the configured OpenTelemetry endpoint.

This directory is intended to house configuration or related files for Prometheus metrics specifically for the Flowise project. It serves as the designated location for Prometheus-related monitoring setup within the Flowise application's metrics collection.

This directory is designated for configurations, instrumentation, or related files pertaining to OpenTelemetry (otel) metrics within the Flowise project. It defines how metrics are collected and exported using the OpenTelemetry standard.

This directory is intended to store Grafana-related configurations, dashboards, or assets for monitoring metrics specific to the Flowise application. It serves as a designated location to centralize monitoring visualizations for Flowise's performance data. Currently, it is an empty placeholder awaiting such content.

This migration file defines the creation and deletion of an 'execution' database table and adds an 'executionId' column to the 'chat_message' table. It manages schema changes related to tracking execution data within the application.
This file is a TypeORM migration for SQLite that creates the 'upsert_history' table to store records of upsert operations, including chatflow IDs, results, flow data, and timestamps.
This TypeORM migration file adds an 'analytic' column of type TEXT to the 'chat_flow' table when applied ('up' method) and removes it when rolled back ('down' method).
This TypeORM migration script creates an 'execution' table in the database and adds an 'executionId' column to the 'chat_message' table, establishing a new entity for tracking executions.
This file is a TypeORM database migration that adds an 'analytic' text column to the 'chat_flow' table and provides a method to revert this change.
This file defines an Express controller for retrieving logs. It handles incoming HTTP requests, calls the log service to fetch logs based on date ranges, and sends the response.

This file defines an Express controller for retrieving statistics related to a specific chatflow. It parses various query parameters like chat types, date ranges, and feedback filters, then delegates the statistical data retrieval to a service layer.
This file implements Express.js controller functions for managing execution records, providing API endpoints for retrieving, updating, deleting, and querying executions with various filters.

This file defines Express controller functions for managing 'upsert history' data. It provides endpoints to retrieve all upsert history entries with filtering and sorting options, and to delete specific entries by ID.
This file provides utility functions for reading and retrieving server log files within a specified date and time range.

This file defines a service layer for managing execution records within the Flowise application, providing functions for retrieving, listing, updating, and deleting executions. It handles database interactions, filtering, and error management related to execution entities.

This file provides a service function (`getChatflowStats`) to retrieve and aggregate various statistics, such as total messages, feedback counts, and unique sessions, for a given chat flow based on specified filters.
This file defines an API client function to fetch statistical data for a specific chatflow. It serves as an interface for the UI to retrieve chatflow performance or usage statistics.
This file defines API functions related to logs. It provides a method to retrieve logs from a backend service, optionally filtered by a start and end date.

This file defines an API client for interacting with execution-related endpoints. It provides functions to retrieve, delete, and update execution records, including a public endpoint for fetching specific execution details.

This component renders a sortable and selectable table for displaying a list of execution records. It includes features like status icons, sorting by various fields, and multi-row selection for managing execution data.

AI Evaluation & Testing.description: Create and manage datasets to systematically test, evaluate, and compare the performance, quality, and cost of different AI workflows and prompts.

files.description: This file defines TypeScript interfaces and an enum for managing datasets and their evaluation processes, including data structures for datasets, dataset rows, evaluations, and individual evaluation runs.

This file defines a custom LangChain callback handler, `EvaluationRunTracer`, which collects and processes metrics like token usage, model names, and execution times for LLM runs. It integrates with an `EvaluationRunner` to persist these metrics for evaluation purposes.

This file defines the EvaluationRunner class, which is responsible for executing chatflow evaluations against a Flowise API. It manages evaluation runs, captures performance, token usage, and calculates cost metrics for each prediction.

This file defines a LlamaIndex callback tracer that monitors and records performance metrics (like execution times, token counts, and model usage) for LLM, retrieval, and agent events during an evaluation run. It integrates with `EvaluationRunner` to store these collected metrics.

This file defines the `EvaluationRun` TypeORM entity, which represents a single evaluation run and stores its input, expected output, actual output, metrics, and associated errors in the database. It is used to persist and retrieve details of code or model evaluation processes.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for 'Evaluation', representing the database schema for storing evaluation records within the Flowise application. It outlines various fields such as metrics, configuration, names, IDs, status, and timestamps related to an evaluation.

This TypeORM migration script creates two new tables, `evaluation` and `evaluation_run`, in the database. These tables are designed to store configuration, status, and results for evaluation runs, likely for AI chatflows or models.
This TypeORM migration file adds an 'errors' column of type LONGTEXT with a default empty array to the `evaluation_run` table, or removes it when rolling back the migration.

This TypeORM migration script for SQLite creates two new database tables: 'evaluation' and 'evaluation_run'. These tables are designed to store data related to AI model or chatflow evaluations and their individual runs, respectively.
This file is a TypeORM migration that adds an 'errors' column (TEXT, NULL, default '[]') to the 'evaluation_run' table in the SQLite database and provides a method to revert this change.

This TypeORM migration script creates two new database tables, `evaluation` and `evaluation_run`, to store data related to AI model evaluations and their individual execution runs. It includes columns for metrics, inputs, outputs, and timestamps.
This TypeORM migration adds an 'errors' column of type LONGTEXT to the 'evaluation_run' table, defaulting to an empty JSON array. It is used to store error information for evaluation runs.

This migration file adds an 'errors' column, of type LONGTEXT, to the 'evaluation_run' table in the database if it doesn't already exist. It also provides the logic to remove this column if the migration is reverted.

This TypeORM migration script adds two new tables, `evaluation` and `evaluation_run`, to the database. These tables are designed to store data related to evaluations, likely for tracking and managing the performance of LLMs or chatbots.
This TypeORM migration adds a new 'errors' column of type TEXT to the 'evaluation_run' table, which defaults to an empty array. It is used to store error information related to evaluation runs.

This file serves as an Express.js controller for managing evaluation-related API endpoints. It handles requests for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting evaluations, delegating the business logic to the evaluations service.

This file provides functions to calculate and format the cost of tokens (prompt, completion, and total) for AI model evaluations based on provided metrics and cost values. It processes an array of metrics, computes individual token costs, and formats them for display.

This file defines services for creating, running, and managing evaluations of chatflows against datasets. It handles data persistence, execution of evaluation logic, and calculation of metrics and costs.

This file defines the `LLMEvaluationRunner` class, which is responsible for dynamically creating and executing large language model (LLM) evaluators. It processes LLM outputs against predefined evaluation criteria and returns structured evaluation results.

This file contains a service function `runAdditionalEvaluators` that executes a series of user-defined evaluators (numeric, JSON, text) against given actual outputs and metrics, returning detailed evaluation results and summary counts.
This file defines API client functions for managing and interacting with 'evaluations', including creating, retrieving, deleting, and running evaluations.
This React component manages and displays a table of evaluations. It provides functionalities to fetch, create, and delete evaluations, including pagination and selection features.
This file implements a multi-step dialog for creating and configuring new evaluation tasks. It guides the user through selecting datasets, evaluators, and LLM grading metrics for an evaluation.

This directory is intended to store static data (fixtures) used by Cypress end-to-end tests for the server component of Flowise. These fixtures provide controlled and predictable data inputs for various test scenarios.
This file serves as an index for all database entities (models) used in the application, importing them from their respective files and exporting them collectively as a single object.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for a `Dataset`, mapping its properties to a database table. It specifies the structure and columns for storing dataset information, including its ID, name, description, timestamps, and associated workspace.
Defines the TypeORM entity for a 'DatasetRow', representing a single entry or row within a dataset, including input, output, and sequence number.
This file is a TypeORM migration that creates `dataset` and `dataset_row` tables in the database, defining their schemas for managing datasets and their associated data rows.

This TypeORM migration script adds a 'sequence_no' integer column with a default value of -1 to the 'dataset_row' table in MariaDB. It also provides the logic to revert this change by dropping the column.
This TypeORM migration script adds a 'sequence_no' column to the 'dataset_row' table. It is used to track the order of rows within a dataset.

This TypeORM migration file for SQLite creates two database tables: 'dataset' and 'dataset_row'. It defines the schema for storing datasets and their corresponding rows, including fields like ID, name, description, input, output, and timestamps.
This TypeORM migration file defines the creation and deletion of two database tables: `dataset` and `dataset_row`. It sets up the schema for storing dataset information and their individual entries.

This TypeORM migration file adds a 'sequence_no' integer column with a default value of -1 to the 'dataset_row' table in a MySQL database. It also provides the corresponding down migration to remove this column.
This TypeORM migration file defines the creation and deletion of 'dataset' and 'dataset_row' tables in a PostgreSQL database, adding database schema support for managing datasets.
This TypeORM migration file adds a 'sequence_no' integer column with a default value of -1 to the 'dataset_row' table in a PostgreSQL database.

This file defines the Express.js controller functions for managing datasets and dataset rows, handling API requests for CRUD operations, pagination, and error handling, delegating business logic to the dataset service.
This file defines a service for managing datasets, including CRUD operations for datasets and their rows, reordering dataset rows, and importing CSV data into datasets.
This file defines API client functions for interacting with backend endpoints related to datasets and their individual rows, enabling operations like creation, retrieval, updates, and deletions.

This file implements the main UI component for managing datasets, including displaying a list of datasets, searching, adding new datasets, editing existing ones, and deleting them. It integrates with an API for data operations and uses Material-UI for the user interface.

This React component manages the display, creation, editing, deletion, and reordering of individual items or rows within a specific dataset. It includes functionalities for pagination, bulk selection, and CSV file uploads for dataset rows.

This file defines a React component for a modal dialog that allows users to add new rows or edit existing rows within a dataset. It handles data input, API calls for creation/update, and displays notifications.

This file defines various interfaces and a Data Transfer Object (DTO) related to data evaluation, datasets, and evaluators within the system. It includes structures for managing evaluation runs, results, and the configuration of different evaluator types.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for an 'Evaluator', mapping its properties like ID, name, type, configuration, and workspace to database columns. It represents an evaluator object within the system's database schema.

This TypeORM migration script creates an 'evaluator' table in the MariaDB database, defining its schema including columns for id, name, type, config, and timestamps. It also provides a rollback function to drop the table.
This migration script creates a new 'evaluator' table in the database. It defines the schema for storing evaluator-related data, including id, name, type, config, and timestamps.

This TypeORM migration file defines the `up` and `down` methods to create and drop an `evaluator` table in a MySQL database, respectively. It adds a new table named `evaluator` with fields for id, name, type, config, createdDate, and updatedDate.

This TypeORM migration file creates an 'evaluator' table in a PostgreSQL database, defining its schema with columns for ID, name, type, configuration, and timestamps. It also provides the logic to drop this table.

This file defines the Express.js controllers for managing 'evaluator' resources, including operations to retrieve, create, update, and delete evaluators. It handles API requests, validates inputs, and delegates business logic to the evaluator service.

This file defines the service layer for managing 'Evaluator' entities within the Flowise application. It provides functions for common CRUD operations such as retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting evaluators in the database.

This file provides a set of API functions for interacting with evaluator resources, including retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting evaluator data. It acts as an API client for the `/evaluators` endpoint.
This file defines an array of standard evaluation prompts used for assessing AI model responses, including metrics like correctness and hallucination, along with their expected JSON output schemas.

This file defines constants for various evaluators used in a UI, including text-based, JSON, and numeric evaluation criteria. It also categorizes these evaluators and specifies available numeric operators.

This React component renders a modal dialog allowing users to select from predefined sample evaluation prompts. It displays the selected prompt's output schema and text, enabling confirmation of the choice.

This React component manages and displays a list of evaluators in a tabular format, providing functionalities such as viewing, searching, adding, editing, and deleting evaluators with pagination support.

This file defines a React component for a dialog that allows users to add or edit 'evaluators' within the application. It handles various evaluator types (text, numeric, LLM) and manages their configuration and persistence via API calls.

This file provides a utility function to retrieve chat message feedback records from the database. It allows filtering by chatflow ID, chat ID, and a creation date range, with options for sorting the results.
This TypeORM migration file creates and drops the `chat_message_feedback` table in a MariaDB database, designed to store user feedback for chat messages within the application.

This TypeORM migration script creates the 'chat_message_feedback' table with columns for ID, chatflow ID, chat ID, message ID, rating, content, and creation date, along with indexes on 'chatflowid' and 'chatId', to store user feedback on chat messages.

This file defines a service layer for managing chat message feedback, including retrieving, adding, and updating feedback entries for chatflows. It acts as an intermediary between API routes and database utility functions for feedback operations.

This file provides utility functions for validating chat message feedback data. It includes checks for the existence of messages and feedback records, and ensures consistency of chat and chatflow IDs during feedback creation and updates.
This file defines a React component, `ChartLatency`, which renders a responsive line chart to visualize latency data for multiple flows.
This file defines a React component that renders a swipeable side drawer. It displays a timeline of different versions for an evaluation result, allowing users to select and view a specific version.

This file defines the `MetricsItemCard` React component, which displays individual metrics or data points within a styled card, including an icon, header, and a custom content component. It also handles a loading state with a skeleton component.
This file defines a React component `ChartPassPrnt` that renders a responsive pie chart to visualize data, likely representing pass/fail/error percentages or similar evaluation metrics.

This file defines a React component, `ChartTokens`, which renders a responsive bar chart to visualize prompt and completion token usage for different flows or inputs. It uses the `recharts` library for charting.

This file implements a SwipeableDrawer component named `EvaluationResultSideDrawer` which displays detailed evaluation results, including inputs, expected outputs, actual outputs, errors, and latency metrics for different chatflows.

This React component displays the detailed results of an evaluation, including metrics, charts for latency and tokens, and provides functionalities to view additional details, versions, and re-run evaluations. It fetches evaluation data from an API and presents it in a comprehensive UI.

This file defines a React component for a full-screen dialog that displays detailed evaluation results. It presents a table comparing inputs, expected outputs, and actual outputs from different chatflows, along with options for viewing custom or LLM evaluations.

Knowledge Base & Vector Management.description: Manage and interact with various vector databases to store, index, and retrieve information, enabling Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for AI agents.

files.description: This file provides utilities and the core `index` function for managing and indexing documents into a vector store. It handles document hashing, deduplication, and tracking document state (additions, updates, deletions) using a record manager.

This file provides functions to handle the upsertion of documents, particularly files, into vector stores within a Flowise chatflow. It manages file processing, validation, storage, and orchestrates the execution of the upsert operation based on the chatflow's configuration.

This file defines the `UpsertQueue` class, which extends `BaseQueue` to manage and process various asynchronous upsert operations for vector stores, document loaders, and related tasks within the application.
This file defines and exports Express middleware functions for handling vector operations, including rate limiting and upserting vector data, by interacting with a vector service.
This file defines a middleware for handling vector upsert operations within the server. It wraps utility functions for vector management and includes error handling.

This file provides API client functions for managing vector store operations, including upserting vector data (with or without form data) and handling the retrieval and deletion of upsert history records.
This file defines the Astra DB API credential, specifying the required inputs like the application token and API endpoint for connecting to Astra DB services within the Flowise platform.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to the Elasticsearch API, specifying inputs like the endpoint and API key. It allows other components to securely access Elasticsearch services.
This file defines the `ChromaApi` credential class, specifying the required input parameters (API key, tenant, and database) for authenticating with the Chroma API within the Flowise system.
This file defines the credential structure for integrating with the Qdrant API, specifically requiring an API key for authentication within the Flowise platform.
Defines the Milvus authentication credentials schema, including fields for username and password, used within the Flowise platform for connecting to Milvus instances.
This file defines the Pinecone API credential structure, specifying the necessary input field (API Key) for authentication within the system.

This file defines an OpenSearch credential type for a system like Flowise, specifying the input fields required to connect to an OpenSearch instance, including its URL, an optional username, and an optional password.

This file defines the credential structure for connecting to a Teradata Vector Store API. It specifies the necessary input fields such as host IP, username, password, base URL, and an optional JWT token for authentication.
This file defines a credential class for the Weaviate API, specifying how to securely input and manage the Weaviate API key within the application.

This file defines the Upstash Vector API credential class for Flowise, specifying the required inputs like REST URL and API token for authentication. It allows the platform to securely store and manage Upstash Vector access details.
This file defines a credential class for the Vectara API, specifying the required input parameters like customer ID, corpus ID, and an API key for authentication within the Flowise system.

This file provides utility functions for configuring and resolving vector stores and retrievers, supporting different search types like similarity and Max Marginal Relevance (MMR). It also includes documentation for integrating file upload functionality with vector stores.

This file defines the AstraDB vector store component for Flowise, enabling users to upsert embedded data and perform similarity or MMR searches using DataStax Astra DB. It handles configuration, credential management, and document processing for integration.
This file documents the Postgres Vector Store integration for Flowise, detailing the environment variables required for its configuration.

This file provides utility functions for retrieving configuration parameters (like host, database, port, SSL, table name, content column name, schema name) for a PostgreSQL vector store. It prioritizes values from node data, then environment variables, and falls back to default values.

This file defines a Flowise node (`Postgres_VectorStores`) that integrates a Postgres database as a vector store. It enables upserting embedded documents and performing similarity searches using pgvector capabilities.

This file defines an abstract base class for integrating with PostgreSQL as a vector store. It provides common methods for configuration, table management, credential retrieval, and instantiating vector store clients.

This file defines a PostgreSQL vector store driver using Langchain's PGVectorStore, which customizes connection handling and metadata filtering. It is currently disabled due to connection management issues, with TypeORM suggested as an alternative.

This file defines the `TypeORMDriver` class, which implements a vector store driver for PostgreSQL databases using TypeORM. It manages database connections, document storage, retrieval, and embedding operations, including customizations for Langchain's TypeORMVectorStore.

This file defines a Flowise node for integrating Couchbase as a vector store. It allows users to upsert documents into Couchbase and retrieve them, handling connection details, data schema, and metadata filtering.

This file defines the `Chroma` class, which serves as a vector store integration for the Chroma database, enabling operations like adding, deleting, and searching documents/vectors within a Chroma instance.
This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with the Chroma vector database, enabling users to upsert documents, perform similarity searches, and manage data within Chroma collections.

This file defines a Flowise node for Meilisearch, enabling users to upsert embedded documents into a Meilisearch index and perform similarity searches using its hybrid search capabilities. It manages index creation, deletion, settings, and document additions.
This file implements a LangChain-compatible vector store for MongoDB Atlas, enabling vector search, storage, and retrieval operations against a MongoDB Atlas collection.
This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with MongoDB Atlas as a vector store. It allows upserting embedded documents and performing similarity or MMR searches using MongoDB Atlas.
This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with the Qdrant vector database. It handles upserting documents, managing embeddings, and performing similarity searches within a Qdrant collection.

This file provides utility functions for escaping and unescaping special characters, specifically hyphens, within strings and objects. These functions are designed to handle character escaping requirements for Redis Search queries.

This file defines a Flowise component for integrating Redis as a vector store. It handles connecting to Redis, upserting document embeddings, and configuring the vector store for similarity search queries.
Defines a Flowise node for integrating with SingleStore vector database, allowing users to upsert embedded data and perform similarity searches.

This file defines a Flowise node for an in-memory vector store. It allows users to store document embeddings in memory and retrieve similar documents based on a given query, functioning as a retriever within the Flowise platform.
This file defines the AWS Kendra vector store component for Flowise, enabling users to integrate Kendra for document retrieval, indexing, and deletion within their applications.

This file defines a Flowise node for interacting with Elasticsearch as a vector store. It allows users to upsert embedded documents, delete documents, and perform similarity searches within an Elasticsearch index.
This file defines a Flowise node for interacting with the Faiss vector store. It enables upserting embedded documents and performing similarity searches using the Faiss library.

This file defines a Flowise node for interacting with Pinecone, a vector database. It enables the upserting, deleting, and querying of embedded data using the Pinecone service within the Flowise platform.

This file implements a Flowise component for integrating Pinecone as a vector store with LlamaIndex, allowing for upserting embedded data and performing similarity searches. Note that this LlamaIndex integration is marked as deprecated.

This file defines a Flowise node for a simple vector store using LlamaIndex, enabling the upsertion of embedded data to a local path and subsequent similarity searches. It also indicates that the LlamaIndex integration is deprecated.
This file defines a Flowise node component for integrating with OpenSearch as a vector store. It enables users to upsert embedded data into OpenSearch and perform similarity searches.

This file defines a Flowise node (`DocStore_VectorStores`) that dynamically creates and manages vector store and embedding instances based on pre-configured document stores. It allows users to select an existing document store and retrieve its associated vector store or retriever for use in a workflow.

This file provides a `FilterParser` class designed to safely parse Supabase filter strings, validate their structure and content against allowed methods and operators, and convert them into executable functions to apply to RPC objects, thereby preventing arbitrary code execution.

This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with Supabase as a vector store, allowing for upserting embedded data, performing similarity or MMR searches, and managing data within Supabase using its pgvector extension.

This file defines a Flowise node (`Upstash_VectorStores`) that integrates with Upstash as a vector store. It provides functionalities to upsert documents, delete documents, and initialize the Upstash vector store for similarity search, supporting embeddings, record management, and metadata filtering.

This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with the Vectara vector store. It allows users to upsert documents and files into Vectara, and configure parameters for similarity search and retrieval.

This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with Zep Cloud, enabling users to upsert documents into a Zep collection and perform similarity or MMR searches. It functions as a Zep Vector Store and Retriever within the Flowise environment.

This file defines a Milvus vector store component for Flowise, enabling the upserting of embedded data and performing similarity searches using the Milvus vector database. It handles configuration, credentials, and secure connections for Milvus interactions.

This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with Weaviate, a vector database. It allows users to upsert embedded documents, configure Weaviate connections, and provides methods for similarity or MMR search, acting as both a retriever and a vector store.
This file defines a Flowise node for integrating with the Zep vector store. It enables users to upsert documents into a Zep collection and perform similarity searches with custom filtering.
Defines a Flowise node for connecting to the AWS Bedrock Knowledge Base API to retrieve relevant document chunks.
This file provides a utility function to reformat LlamaIndex `NodeWithScore` objects into a simplified array of source documents, extracting `pageContent` and `metadata`.
Defines a deprecated LlamaIndex-based query engine node for Flowise, enabling question answering over data with optional response synthesis and source document retrieval capabilities.

This file defines a `MeilisearchRetriever` class that extends Langchain's `BaseRetriever`. It enables searching and retrieving documents from a Meilisearch index using semantic search with embeddings and hybrid search capabilities.

This file defines a Flowise node for a Multi Retrieval QA Chain, which answers questions by automatically selecting the most appropriate vector store from multiple provided retrievers. It integrates with Langchain's MultiRetrievalQAChain and handles input moderation, streaming, and logging.

This file implements a LangChain-compatible QA chain for interacting with the Vectara platform, providing functionalities for question answering, summarization, and citation management using Vectara's services.

This file defines a Flowise node wrapper for the Langchain RetrievalQAChain, allowing users to perform question answering over retrieved documents using a language model and a vector store retriever. It includes features like input moderation and streaming responses.

This file defines a Flowise node component for integrating Langchain's `VectorDBQAChain`, allowing users to perform question-answering over a vector database with language models, input moderation, and streaming support. This component is currently marked as 'DEPRECATING'.

This file defines a Flowise node that retrieves documents from a vector store based on a query, with optional filtering by minimum similarity score. It can output the retrieved documents as an array or as a concatenated string of their content.

This file implements the Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) algorithm. It generates multiple search queries using an LLM, retrieves documents for each query, and then re-ranks them based on RRF scores to improve retrieval relevance.

This file defines a Flowise node for a Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) retriever, which enhances search results by generating multiple queries, re-ranking them using RRF, and optionally compressing the output.

This file defines a Flowise node (`LLMFilterCompressionRetriever_Retrievers`) that implements an LLM-powered contextual compression retriever. It combines a base retriever with a language model to extract and return only the most relevant parts of retrieved documents based on a given query.
Defines a Flowise node that encapsulates a vector store as a retriever, allowing it to be used in workflows for retrieval-augmented generation tasks.

This file defines a Flowise node for the Langchain HyDE Retriever, allowing users to configure and utilize a HyDE retriever with a language model, vector store, and various prompt options to fetch relevant documents.

This file defines a custom retriever node for a workflow system, enabling users to retrieve documents from a vector store and format their output based on a specified template that can include document content and metadata.

This file defines a Flowise node (`MultiQueryRetriever_Retrievers`) that integrates Langchain's MultiQueryRetriever. Its purpose is to generate multiple variations of a user's question using a language model to improve document retrieval from a vector store.

This file defines a Flowise node for a Similarity Score Threshold Retriever, which wraps Langchain's ScoreThresholdRetriever. It allows users to retrieve documents from a vector store based on a minimum similarity percentage, with configurable parameters for result limits and increment steps.

This file defines a custom node for Flowise that implements an Embeddings Filter Retriever, which uses contextual compression with embeddings to filter documents based on similarity to a query. It allows configuring a base retriever, embeddings, query, similarity threshold, and the number of relevant documents to return.

This file defines a Flowise node (`ExtractMetadataRetriever`) that leverages a language model to extract structured metadata or keywords from a user query. This extracted information is then used as a filter to retrieve more relevant documents from a connected vector store.

This file defines a Flowise node (`DocStore_DocumentLoaders`) that allows users to load documents from pre-configured document stores managed in a database. It can retrieve documents as an array of structured objects or a concatenated string of their content.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for 'DocumentStore', representing the schema for storing document store configurations or metadata in the database. It includes properties such as name, description, status, and various configuration details for vector and embedding stores.
This file defines a TypeORM entity for storing a single chunk of a document, including its content, metadata, and identifiers linking it to a specific document and document store.

This TypeORM migration file adds `vectorStoreConfig`, `embeddingConfig`, and `recordManagerConfig` columns to the `document_store` table in a MariaDB database. These columns are used to store configuration details related to vector stores, embeddings, and record managers respectively.

This TypeORM migration for MariaDB alters the `document_store_file_chunk` table, changing the `pageContent` and `metadata` columns to `LONGTEXT` to accommodate larger data, preventing potential data truncation.

This migration adds `vectorStoreConfig`, `embeddingConfig`, and `recordManagerConfig` columns to the `document_store` table in SQLite, allowing for more flexible configuration of document storage and embedding processes.

This TypeORM migration file defines the schema for `document_store` and `document_store_file_chunk` tables in a MySQL database. It handles the creation and dropping of these tables, which are used to manage document storage and their respective file chunks.

This TypeORM migration adds new columns 'vectorStoreConfig', 'embeddingConfig', and 'recordManagerConfig' to the 'document_store' table in a MySQL database. These columns are intended to store configuration details related to vector stores, embeddings, and record managers.

This TypeORM migration modifies the `document_store_file_chunk` table in a MySQL database, changing the `pageContent` and `metadata` columns to `LONGTEXT` to accommodate larger data, and reverts them to `TEXT` on rollback.
This TypeORM migration script adds two new tables, `document_store` and `document_store_file_chunk`, to the database, along with indexes, to manage stored documents and their content chunks.
This migration script adds columns for vector store, embedding, and record manager configurations to the 'document_store' table in a PostgreSQL database.

This file defines the Express.js controller for managing document stores, their loaders, and file chunks within the Flowise application. It exposes API endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting document store-related resources.
This file provides an API client for managing document stores, including operations for document loaders, data chunking, and integration with vector stores within the application.

This file defines a Flowise node for managing records in a MySQL database, specifically for tracking document writes into vector databases. It handles connection, schema creation, and configuration for record management operations.
This file is a README for the Postgres Record Manager integration in Flowise, documenting its purpose, configurable environment variables, and licensing information.

This file provides utility functions for retrieving PostgreSQL connection and table configuration parameters for a record manager, prioritizing values from node data, environment variables, or sensible defaults.

This file defines a PostgreSQL-based record manager designed to track document writes and changes within vector databases. It includes a Flowise component (`PostgresRecordManager_RecordManager`) for integrating this functionality, allowing configuration of database connection details and cleanup strategies.
This file defines a Flowise node component that uses SQLite as a record manager to track document upserts and deletions in vector databases.

This file defines a Flowise node wrapper for Langchain's `CharacterTextSplitter`, enabling text splitting based on a specified character separator with configurable chunk size and overlap within the Flowise platform.

This file defines a Flowise node for code-aware text splitting. It utilizes Langchain's RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter to segment documents based on language-specific syntax, with configurable chunk size and overlap.
This file defines a Flowise node that wraps Langchain's RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter, allowing users to configure text splitting with options like chunk size, overlap, and custom separators.
This file defines a Flowise node for a token-based text splitter, enabling the splitting of raw text into chunks based on BPE tokens and configurable encoding, chunk size, and overlap.

This file defines a Flowise node that provides a configurable Markdown text splitter. It allows users to split documents based on chunk size, chunk overlap, and optionally by specific Markdown header levels.

This file defines an Express.js controller for managing OpenAI Assistant Vector Stores, including operations like creating, retrieving, listing, updating, deleting, uploading files, and deleting files from these vector stores. It handles incoming HTTP requests and delegates the business logic to a service layer.

This file provides service functions for managing OpenAI Assistant Vector Stores, including creating, retrieving, listing, updating, deleting, and uploading/deleting files from them. It handles API key decryption and interaction with the OpenAI API.

This file implements a React dialog component for managing OpenAI Assistant Vector Stores. It allows users to create new vector stores, edit existing ones (including name and expiration settings), select from available vector stores, and delete them, interacting with an API for these operations and providing user feedback.

This file defines the `DocumentStoreCard` React component, which displays a summary card for a document store, including its name, description, status, usage statistics, and associated images, with interactive hover effects.

This file defines the `DocumentStoreTable` React component, which renders a sortable Material-UI table to display document store entries. It shows details like name, description, connected flows, character/chunk counts, and loader types, supporting loading states and row click events.

This file defines the `ExpandedChunkDialog` React component, which provides a modal dialog for viewing, editing, and deleting individual document chunks. It displays the chunk's content and metadata, supporting actions like edit, save, cancel, and delete with integrated role-based access control (RBAC).

This file defines a React component, `AddDocStoreDialog`, which provides a modal dialog for users to add new document stores or edit existing ones. It handles form input, interacts with an API for creation and updates, and displays user notifications.

This React component renders a dialog displaying detailed history of upsert operations, including statistics (added, updated, skipped, deleted counts) and expandable flow data nodes with their configurations. It uses Material-UI components and React Portals for display.

This component (`ShowStoredChunks`) is responsible for displaying, managing (editing and deleting), and paginating through document chunks stored for a specific file within a document store. It retrieves chunk data from an API and provides UI elements for interaction.

This file implements a side drawer component that displays a historical timeline of upsert operations for a document store, showing details like added, updated, skipped, and deleted counts for each past operation.

This file implements a React dialog component (`DocStoreAPIDialog`) that displays API documentation and code examples (Python, JavaScript, cURL) for upserting documents to a document store. It dynamically generates these examples based on the document store's configuration, providing instructions for both form-data and JSON-based requests.

This file implements a React component for configuring a vector store within a document storage system. It allows users to select and configure embedding providers, vector store providers, and optional record managers, and also view the history of data upserts.

This React component provides a user interface for querying a specific vector store and displaying the retrieved document chunks. It also allows for configuring the vector store's settings within the UI.

This React component displays the detailed view of a specific document store, allowing users to manage associated document loaders, view document chunks, query the store, and perform actions like deleting the store or individual loaders.

This React component renders a dialog for confirming the deletion of a document store. It displays configuration details for associated vector store and record manager nodes, and provides warnings about the implications of deletion, especially regarding data persistence without a record manager.

This component allows users to configure a document loader and a text splitter for a document store, preview how documents will be chunked, and then initiate the saving and processing of these chunks.

This React component displays the status of a document store item, providing color-coded visual indicators. It renders different UI elements (a pill with text or a simple colored dot) based on the display context (detailed view or table view).

This React component displays and manages document stores, allowing users to view them in either a card or list layout, search, paginate, and add new document stores. It integrates with an API to fetch and display document store data.

This React component provides a UI element (a floating action button) that, when clicked, opens a dialog for users to upsert data into a vector store. It also manages and displays a subsequent dialog to show the results of that upsert operation.

This file implements a React component `UpsertHistoryDialog` which displays a dialog containing the upsert history for a vector store. It allows users to view, filter by date, select, and see detailed information about past upsert operations, including associated flow data.

This file defines a React component, `UpsertResultDialog`, which displays the results of an upsert operation, including statistics (added, updated, skipped, deleted records) and details of any added documents. It provides options to close the dialog or navigate to a retrieval test if available.

This file implements a React component for a dialog that displays API integration examples (Python, JavaScript, cURL) for upserting data to a vector store, based on the configuration of selected nodes in a chatflow. It provides code snippets for both JSON and FormData requests.

Data Ingestion & Connectors.description: Ingest data from a diverse set of sources including files (PDF, CSV), websites, and SaaS applications (Notion, GitHub) to build rich knowledge bases for your AI agents.

files.description: This file provides utility functions for managing and storing files, supporting local filesystem, AWS S3, and Google Cloud Storage (GCS) backends. It handles file uploads, retrieval, and size calculations across these storage types.

This file contains unit tests for the `validateMimeTypeAndExtensionMatch` function, ensuring it correctly validates filenames and MIME types. It covers scenarios including valid matches, invalid inputs, path traversal attempts, missing extensions, unsupported MIME types, and mismatches between file extensions and MIME types.
This file is the README for the S3 File Loader component in Flowise, describing its purpose, environmental variables, and licensing information.

This file defines data models, interfaces, and utility functions for managing document stores within the Flowise application. It includes enumerations for document store statuses, interfaces for document store components (loaders, files, chunks), and a DTO for converting document store entities.

This file provides a function to handle file uploads for a chatflow, including validation, storage, processing through a file loader component, and managing storage quotas. It ensures file integrity and security while attaching files to a chat.

This file defines a utility function to determine and return the upload capabilities (speech-to-text, image, and RAG file uploads) configured for a given chatflow, including allowed file types and sizes.
This TypeORM migration script creates two new database tables, `document_store` and `document_store_file_chunk`, for managing and storing document data and their respective chunks.

This migration file adds two new tables to the SQLite database: `document_store` for managing document storage metadata and `document_store_file_chunk` for storing document content chunks, along with their respective indexes.
This file defines an Express controller for managing attachments, specifically handling the creation of new attachments by delegating the request to the attachment service.

This file defines Express.js controllers for managing files within the application's storage system. It provides functionalities to list all files associated with an organization and to delete specific files, updating storage usage accordingly.
This file provides a service function for creating attachments, wrapping a utility function with error handling. It exports the `createAttachment` function for use within the application.

This file defines the service layer for managing document stores, including operations like creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting document stores, their associated loaders, and file chunks, often involving database interactions and file storage.
This file defines a credential handler for integrating with the Confluence Cloud API. It specifies the necessary input fields, such as Access Token and Username, for authentication.
This file defines the credential class for authenticating with the GitHub API, specifying the input required (an access token) for connection.

This file defines the Apify API credential class, specifying how to store and access the Apify API token within the system. It describes the label, name, version, and input fields required for the Apify API credential.

This file defines the Confluence Server/Data Center API credential, specifying the necessary input fields like a Personal Access Token for authentication. It provides the structure for integrating Confluence Server/Data Center API access within the Flowise platform.

This file defines the Google Calendar OAuth2 credential configuration for the Flowise platform. It specifies the necessary input parameters like client ID, client secret, and OAuth URLs for connecting to Google Calendar services.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to the Airtable API within the Flowise platform. It specifies that an 'Access Token' is required for authentication with Airtable services.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to the Couchbase API, specifying the required input parameters such as connection string, username, and password.

This file defines the `GoogleDocsOAuth2` credential class, providing the necessary configuration and input parameters for authenticating with Google Docs using OAuth2 within the Flowise platform. It specifies the scopes, authorization URLs, and client details required for integration.
This file defines the Google Sheets OAuth2 credential class for Flowise, specifying the configuration parameters required for authenticating with Google Sheets API, including scopes and endpoints.
This file defines a Google Drive OAuth2 credential class for the Flowise platform, providing the necessary configuration and parameters for authenticating with Google Drive services.

This file defines the Microsoft Outlook OAuth2 credential class for Flowise, specifying the necessary authorization parameters, client details, and API scopes for connecting to Microsoft Outlook services.
This file defines the SingleStore API credential class, specifying the required user and password inputs for authentication within the Flowise platform.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to MongoDB ATLAS using a connection URL. It specifies the input field required for the MongoDB ATLAS connection string within the Flowise platform.

This file defines a Teradata Bearer Token credential class for Flowise, enabling authentication with Teradata services using a provided token. It specifies the input field for the token and provides a link to official documentation for obtaining it.

This file defines the credentials class for connecting to a PostgreSQL API, specifying the required input fields like username and password. It enables the system to securely handle PostgreSQL authentication.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to a Neo4j API, specifying the required input parameters such as URL, username, and password.
This file defines a credential class for handling Postgres database connection URLs within the Flowise platform, providing a structured way to input and manage these connection strings.
This file defines a credential class for connecting to the Notion API. It specifies the input required, specifically an integration token, for authentication with Notion.

This file defines the MySQL API credential class for the Flowise platform, specifying the required user and password inputs for connecting to a MySQL database. It serves as a component for managing MySQL connection credentials within the system.

This file defines a credential class (`TeradataTD2Credential`) for authenticating with Teradata TD2, specifying the required username and password inputs. It is part of Flowise's component package for managing credentials.

This file defines a Flowise node (`VectaraUpload_VectorStores`) that enables users to upload files to a Vectara vector store. It handles file processing (from base64 or storage) and integrates with Vectara to index the content, providing options to return a Vectara retriever or the vector store itself.
This file defines a Flowise node for loading documents from an Airtable table. It handles fetching data, applying text splitting, and managing document metadata.

This file defines a Flowise node for loading data from Google Sheets. It allows users to select spreadsheets and sheets, specify ranges, and convert the sheet data into documents with optional text splitting and metadata handling.

This file implements an API document loader that fetches data from a specified API endpoint using HTTP GET or POST requests, handles headers, body, and optional SSL certificates, and returns the response as structured documents for further processing.
This file defines a Flowise node component for loading document data from a Figma file using the Langchain FigmaFileLoader, allowing for optional text splitting and metadata manipulation.

This file defines a Flowise node (`Github_DocumentLoaders`) that loads document content from a specified GitHub repository. It supports configurations for repository details, authentication, text splitting, and metadata processing.

This file defines a Flowise node class (`Gitbook_DocumentLoaders`) that loads documents from GitBook, optionally splitting text and managing metadata. It integrates with Langchain's GitbookLoader to extract content for further processing.

This file defines a Flowise node (`NotionPage_DocumentLoaders`) responsible for loading document content from a specified Notion page, with options for text splitting, custom metadata, and metadata key omission. It can output either an array of processed documents or a single concatenated text string.

This file defines a Flowise node for loading documents from a Notion database. It handles data retrieval, optional text splitting, and metadata customization before outputting the content as structured documents or concatenated text.

This file defines a Flowise node that loads documents from an exported Notion folder. It allows for optional text splitting, custom metadata addition, and omission of default metadata keys before returning the processed documents or their concatenated text content.

This file defines a Flowise node, 'Jira Document Loader', which extracts issues from a specified Jira project. It supports optional text splitting, metadata enrichment, and custom output formatting for the loaded documents.

This file defines a Flowise component that loads documents from Google Drive. It supports various file types, allowing users to select specific files or load from a folder, with options for filtering and text splitting.

This file defines a Flowise node for loading documents from Confluence, including handling authentication, text splitting, and metadata customization. It enables users to integrate Confluence content into their AI workflows.

This file defines a Flowise node for loading documents from an AWS S3 bucket. It downloads specified files from S3 and then uses various Langchain document loaders (e.g., PDF, CSV, JSON, Text) to process them.
This file defines a Flowise node class for connecting to and interacting with a Neo4j graph database, allowing users to configure database, timeout, and schema options.

This file defines a Flowise node (`Csv_DocumentLoaders`) responsible for loading and processing data from CSV files. It supports options for text splitting, extracting specific columns, and managing metadata before outputting documents or concatenated text.

This file defines a `CSVLoader` class that extends Langchain's `TextLoader` to parse CSV files. It uses `papaparse` to load data, allowing for extraction of a specific column or converting each row into a structured text document.
This file is a README for the Unstructured File/Folder Loader integration within Flowise. It provides an overview of the component, lists relevant environment variables, and specifies the license.

This file defines the `UnstructuredLoader` class, which extends Langchain's `BaseDocumentLoader` to integrate with the Unstructured API. It provides functionality to load and process documents from a buffer, sending them to the Unstructured API for parsing and returning a structured array of `Document` objects.
This file defines a component for Flowise that uses Unstructured.io to load documents from a specified folder, allowing for various configurations like API URL, strategy, encoding, and OCR languages.

This file defines a Flowise component, 'Unstructured File Loader', which integrates with the Unstructured.io service to load and process various file types into documents, supporting options like strategy, encoding, and chunking.

This file defines a Flowise node for loading and processing EPUB files. It handles file input, text splitting, and metadata management, providing either structured documents or concatenated text content.

This file defines a `WordLoader` class responsible for loading and parsing Word documents. It uses the `officeparser` library to extract text and then heuristically splits the content into logical sections, returning an array of `Document` objects.

This file defines a Flowise node component responsible for loading and processing Microsoft Word documents (.docx, .doc). It handles file input from various sources, applies text splitting, manages metadata, and outputs structured document objects.

Defines a FlowiseAI component for loading various document types (PDF, DOCX, CSV, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) from an AWS S3 bucket, offering both built-in processing and integration with Unstructured.io for advanced parsing.

This file implements a document loader for JSON Lines files. It facilitates loading data from `.jsonl` files, extracting content using JSON pointers, and managing metadata, including text splitting and dynamic metadata assignment.

This file defines a Flowise node component for loading and processing JSON files. It enables extracting data based on specified pointers, applying text splitting, and managing document metadata before returning processed documents or concatenated text.
This file defines a Flowise node that loads content from PDF files, allowing for text splitting, metadata manipulation, and retrieval of documents either per page or per file.

This file defines a document loader class, `PowerpointLoader`, that extracts text content from PowerPoint files using `officeparser`. It parses each slide into a separate document, including metadata such as slide number.

This file defines a document loader node for Flowise that processes Microsoft PowerPoint files (.pptx, .ppt). It loads content from PowerPoint documents, optionally splits the text, and manages metadata, preparing it for further use in a workflow.

This file defines a document loader (`LoadOfSheet`) that reads Microsoft Excel files. It parses each worksheet into a collection of documents, with each row becoming a separate document containing its content and metadata like the sheet name and row number.

This file defines a Flowise node for loading and processing data from Microsoft Excel files. It handles file input (local or from storage), extracts content, applies text splitting if configured, and manages associated metadata before outputting documents or concatenated text.

This file defines a generic document loader node for the Flowise platform, enabling the ingestion and processing of various file types like text, JSON, CSV, PDF, and Office documents, with options for text splitting and metadata handling.

This file defines a Flowise component (`Folder_DocumentLoaders`) responsible for loading and processing documents from a specified folder. It supports various file types (e.g., JSON, text, CSV, PDF, Office documents, code files), applies optional text splitting, and allows for custom metadata handling.

This file defines a Flowise node (`Docx_DocumentLoaders`) responsible for loading data from DOCX files. It can retrieve files from storage or directly from base64 data, apply a text splitter, process metadata, and output either structured documents or concatenated text content.

This file defines a Flowise node class, `PlainText_DocumentLoaders`, responsible for loading plain text. It can optionally split the text, add metadata, and output either structured document objects or the processed text content.

This file defines a Flowise component (`Text_DocumentLoaders`) responsible for loading content from various text-based files, handling text splitting, and managing associated metadata before returning the processed documents or their concatenated text.
This file defines a text splitter that converts HTML content to Markdown and then splits the resulting Markdown text based on headers, intended for use as a node in Flowise.
Defines a Flowise document loader node that fetches search results from the BraveSearch API, processes them into Langchain Document objects, and allows for text splitting and metadata manipulation.

This file implements a document loader that leverages the Oxylabs API to scrape and extract content from websites or search results. It integrates this functionality into Flowise as a 'Document Loaders' node, allowing users to configure parameters for data extraction.

This file defines a Flowise component that utilizes the Cheerio library to scrape content from web pages. It supports loading data from single URLs, crawling relative links, applying CSS selectors for extraction, and processing documents with text splitters and metadata management.

This file defines an integration with the Firecrawl API, providing functionalities to scrape, crawl, and extract data from web pages. It includes data structures and client methods for interacting with the Firecrawl service.
This file defines a Playwright-based web scraper component that loads and processes data from web pages. It supports options for URL crawling, CSS selection, text splitting, and metadata handling.

This file defines a Flowise component for scraping web pages using Puppeteer. It allows loading data from URLs, optionally crawling relative links, and extracting content based on various options like CSS selectors or wait conditions.

This file implements a document loader node for Flowise that uses the Spider API to scrape or crawl web pages. It fetches content from specified URLs, processes it (including optional text splitting), and returns it as structured documents or concatenated text.
This file defines the SpiderApp class, a client for interacting with the Spider Cloud API to scrape and crawl URLs and retrieve document data.

This file implements a document loader that uses the SerpApi to perform web searches and load the results as documents. It allows for query input, text splitting, and custom metadata handling for the loaded documents.

This file defines an Express.js controller for fetching links. It validates incoming request parameters (URL, relativeLinksMethod, limit) and then uses a service to retrieve and return the requested links.

This file provides a service function `getAllLinks` that fetches links from a given URL using either web crawling or XML scraping, after checking against a deny list. It handles URL decoding, method validation, and error management.

This file defines an API client for fetching links from a specified URL. It exports a function `fetchLinks` that makes a GET request to a backend endpoint, including parameters for the URL and relative link handling.
This file provides an API client function to create attachments for a specific chatflow and chat, typically used for uploading files via a multipart form data request.
This file provides API client functions for interacting with file-related endpoints, specifically to retrieve all files and delete a specific file.

This file implements a React component for a dialog that allows users to manage scraped links. It provides functionality to fetch links from a given URL, add/remove individual links, clear all links, and save the modified list of links.

This React component (`FileUpload.jsx`) provides a user interface for configuring file upload settings within a chatbot, allowing users to enable/disable file uploads, select allowed file types, and specify PDF handling options.
A React UI component for file uploads, supporting both reading files as Data URLs and preparing them for form data submission, with options for single or multiple file selection.

This file defines a React component, `FilesTable`, which renders a customizable Material-UI table to display a list of files. It includes features for showing file name, path, size, and actions like deletion, along with loading state indicators.

This file defines a React component for a dialog that enables users to upload a CSV file to an existing dataset, offering an option to treat the first row as headers. It handles the API call for adding new dataset rows and displays success or error notifications.

This file implements a React component, `AddEditDatasetDialog`, which provides a modal dialog for users to add new datasets or edit existing ones. It includes input fields for dataset name and description, and allows uploading a CSV file for new datasets.
This file defines the Files view component, responsible for fetching, displaying, searching, and managing (deleting) a list of files using a data table and interacting with a files API.
This React component displays a searchable dialog containing a list of document loaders fetched from an API, allowing users to select a specific document loader.

This file defines a React component for a dialog that displays a searchable and filterable list of components (providers/loaders) for user selection in the Flowise UI. It fetches available components via an API and allows users to pick one, dispatching Redux actions to manage its visibility.

This component (`DocStoreInputHandler`) is responsible for rendering and managing various input fields for a document store within the Flowise UI. It dynamically displays different UI controls (e.g., text inputs, dropdowns, switches, file uploads, code editors, data grids) based on the input parameter type and handles user input changes.

Visual AI Workflow Builder.description: A drag-and-drop canvas for visually designing, building, and managing complex AI workflows and conversational agents without writing code.

files.description: This file defines core interfaces, types, and abstract classes for various components within the Flowise platform, including node parameters, agent configurations, prompt templates, and custom memory implementations based on Langchain.
This file defines a deprecated LlamaIndex node for Flowise that acts as a simple response builder. It combines individual query responses from text chunks into a single string output.

This file implements a Flowise node for a conversational AI chain using Langchain. It orchestrates chat models, memory, prompt templates, and moderation to manage and process conversational interactions, including support for multi-modal (vision) inputs.

This file defines a custom node for a flow-based environment, encapsulating the Langchain MultiPromptChain functionality. It allows the system to automatically select the most appropriate prompt from multiple templates based on user input, and includes features like input moderation and streaming responses.

This file defines a 'Phoenix' analytic node component for the Flowise platform, specifying its properties and credential requirements. It registers this component as 'Phoenix_Analytic' for use within the system.

This file defines a Flowise node component for creating and managing chat prompt templates. It allows users to configure system and human messages, and dynamically inject message history using custom JavaScript code.

This file defines a Flowise node (`FewShotPromptTemplate_Prompts`) that allows users to create and configure a Few-Shot Prompt Template using Langchain's `FewShotPromptTemplate` class. It enables setting examples, a prefix, suffix, and an example prompt to guide the AI model's responses.

Defines a node class (`PromptTemplate_Prompts`) for creating and configuring Langchain's PromptTemplate objects within a larger system like Flowise. It allows users to specify a prompt template string and its input variables, and optionally provide values for formatting.

This file defines a custom Flowise node named 'Prompt Retriever'. It allows users to define and store prompt templates, including a system message, along with a name and description, for later retrieval and use by other components like a MultiPromptChain.

This file defines a 'Set Variable' utility node for a Flowise application. It allows users to store a given input value under a specified variable name, making it accessible later during the runtime of the workflow.

This file defines the 'StickyNote' component, which is a utility node for adding notes within the Flowise application. It implements the INode interface and provides properties and an input for note content.

This file defines a utility node for Flowise that retrieves a variable by its name, which was previously saved using a 'Set Variable' node. It allows accessing dynamic variables within the Flowise environment.

This file defines the `NodesPool` class responsible for dynamically discovering and loading Flowise components (nodes and credentials) from the `flowise-components` package. It initializes, processes, and stores these components for use within the application, handling icons and filtering based on configuration.
This file defines an Express controller responsible for handling API requests related to retrieving all node configurations, utilizing a service layer for business logic.
This file defines an Express controller that handles requests to retrieve and serve specific node icons. It fetches icon files (SVG, PNG, JPG) based on a node's name from the application's node pool.

This file defines Express.js controller functions for handling HTTP requests related to 'nodes' within the Flowise application. It orchestrates interactions with the nodes service to retrieve, process, and return node-related data or assets.

This file defines a service for managing and retrieving component credentials and their associated icons within the Flowise application. It provides functions to get all credentials, specific credentials by name, and credential icons.

This file defines a service function, `getAllNodeConfigs`, responsible for retrieving available node configurations based on a provided request body and the application's component credentials. It acts as a central point for fetching node configurations within the Flowise application.

This file provides service functions for managing and interacting with component nodes in the Flowise application. It includes functionalities to retrieve node definitions, icons, dynamic options, and execute custom node functions.
This file contains Cypress E2E tests for the `/api/v1/variables` API endpoint in Flowise, covering CRUD operations for variables. The tests are currently commented out or skipped.
This file contains a utility function that enhances a list of keys by querying the database for associated chatflows and embedding their details (name, category, update date) into each key object.

This file contains utility functions for handling base64 encoded files embedded within chatflow definitions. It includes functions to detect base64 files and to extract, store, and replace them with file paths within the chatflow's flow data, managing storage usage and quotas.

This file acts as a core utility hub for the Flowise server, providing functions for graph manipulation of flow definitions, path resolution, and managing application-wide constants. It also centralizes database entity mappings and AWS Secrets Manager integration.

This file defines core TypeScript types, enums, and interfaces for the Flowise application, encompassing data structures for chatflows, messages, tools, credentials, execution parameters, and UI components like React Flow nodes and edges.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for 'ChatFlow', representing a chat flow within the Flowise application. It specifies the database schema for chat flows, including their ID, name, flow data, type, and various configurations.
