This component provides a user interface for managing and saving a list of allowed domains (origins) and an associated error message for a chatbot configuration. It allows users to add, remove, and edit domains, which are then persisted via an API call.

This React component provides a user interface for configuring and managing 'starter prompts' for a chatbot. It allows users to add, edit, and remove prompts, which are then saved to the chatbot's configuration via an API.

This file implements a React UI component for configuring and saving chat feedback settings within a chatflow. It allows users to enable/disable chat feedback and persists these settings via an API call.

This React component provides a user interface for configuring lead capture settings within a chatflow. It allows users to enable/disable lead capture, customize form titles and success messages, and select which contact fields (name, email, phone) to collect.

This file defines the `SSEStreamer` class, which manages connected clients and streams various Server-Sent Events (SSE), such as tokens, errors, metadata, and TTS data, to them using Express response objects.

This file defines the `RedisEventPublisher` class, which implements `IServerSideEventStreamer` to publish various chat-related events (e.g., token, tool, agent actions) to a Redis server using its publish/subscribe mechanism. It manages Redis client connection, event listeners, and streams structured event data to specific chat IDs.
This file defines Express.js controller functions for handling chatbot predictions, including input validation, origin checking, rate limiting, and streaming responses (Server-Sent Events).
This file defines internal API controller functions for handling chatflow predictions. It provides endpoints for both standard and Server-Sent Events (SSE) streaming responses based on user input.
This is the README file for the Flowise UI package, detailing its purpose as the React frontend for Flowise and providing installation instructions.
This file defines a Redux reducer responsible for managing the state of UI notifications (snackbars), handling actions to enqueue, close, and remove them.
This file implements a Redux reducer for managing the state of a confirmation dialog, handling actions to show or hide it and setting its title, description, and button names.

This file defines a Redux reducer that manages UI customization settings such as menu state, font family, border radius, layout orientation, and dark mode. It initializes settings from a configuration or local storage and updates them based on dispatched actions.

This file defines and customizes the typography styles and other UI component appearances (like input fields, main content areas, and avatars) for a UI theme. It exports a function that takes a theme object and returns various style configurations.
This file defines and exports a function that generates a color palette object for the UI theme, adapting colors for different modes (e.g., dark mode) based on the provided theme customization.
This file defines and exports the application's Material-UI theme, dynamically configuring colors, typography, and component styles based on customization options like dark mode.

This file defines global style overrides for various Material-UI components, applying custom theming and dark mode adjustments. It customizes the appearance of elements like scrollbars, buttons, inputs, and list items to match the application's design system.
This file defines styled Material-UI components for creating an interactive image button, including its base styling, image source, backdrop, and hover/focus effects.

This file defines a custom `Avatar` React component that extends Material-UI's `MuiAvatar`, adding props for color, outline, and predefined size variations. It provides consistent styling for avatars within the UI.
This component defines and renders the application's logo, dynamically switching between a dark and light version based on the current theme setting from the Red Redux store.
This file defines a React component that provides a toolbar with a toggleable view selector, allowing users to switch between 'list' and 'module' views using icons.

Marketplace & Reusable Templates.description: Discover, share, and reuse pre-built chatflow templates from a central marketplace to accelerate development and leverage community-built solutions.

files.description: This file defines a utility function `parsePrompt` that processes a JSON string representing a prompt. It extracts and categorizes individual message templates (system, human, AI) or a single prompt template from the provided JSON structure.

This file defines a service function (`createPrompt`) responsible for fetching a prompt from Langchain Hub, parsing its templates, and returning the structured prompt data. It centralizes the logic for prompt retrieval and initial processing within the application.
This file provides a service function (`createPromptsList`) that fetches a list of prompt repositories from the Langchain Hub API. It allows filtering by tags and returns the retrieved repositories.

This file defines a React component that renders a dialog for browsing and selecting prompts from the Langsmith Hub. Users can filter prompts by model, use case, and language, view prompt details, and select a prompt for use.

This file defines the TypeORM entity for 'CustomTemplate', mapping it to the 'custom_template' table in the database. It specifies the structure and properties of custom templates, including their data, name, description, and timestamps.

This file is a TypeORM migration script for MariaDB, responsible for creating and dropping the `custom_template` table in the database. It defines the schema for storing custom template configurations.
This TypeORM migration creates a `custom_template` table in the SQLite database to store custom template definitions. It includes fields for ID, name, flow data, description, and timestamps.
This file is a TypeORM migration script that creates a 'custom_template' table in the database to store custom template definitions. It also includes a `down` method to drop this table.

This TypeORM migration file defines the creation of a `custom_template` table in a PostgreSQL database. It includes columns for ID, name, flow data, description, badge, framework, use cases, type, and timestamps.

This file defines controller functions for handling API requests related to marketplace templates, including fetching, saving, and deleting both general and custom templates. It serves as an interface between the API routes and the `marketplacesService`.

This file manages the export and import functionality for various data entities within the Flowise application, such as chatflows, assistants, messages, and tools. It defines the structure for export input and output, fetches data from different services, and handles potential ID conflicts during import.

This file provides services for managing both pre-defined marketplace templates (chatflows, tools, agentflows) and user-created custom templates within the Flowise application. It handles fetching, saving, and deleting various types of templates, including their associated flow data.

This directory is intended to house various tools or integrations specifically designed for the marketplaces within the Flowise server-side application. It would contain functionalities or connectors that extend the capabilities offered through different marketplaces, serving as a dedicated location for managing marketplace-specific utilities.

This directory is intended to house definitions and configurations for chat flows that are specific to marketplace integrations within the Flowise server. It plays a role in organizing specialized chat workflows consumed or offered through marketplace functionalities.
This file defines API client functions for interacting with various marketplaces (chatflows, tools, templates) and managing custom templates, including fetching, saving, and deleting them.

This React component provides a dialog for exporting a chatflow or tool as a reusable custom template. It allows users to define template details like name, description, badge, and associated use cases before saving it via an API.

This file defines the `MarketplaceTable` React component, which renders a customizable table for displaying marketplace items like templates or tools. It includes features such as filtering, loading skeletons, and actions for opening, sharing, and deleting items.

This file defines the MarketplaceCanvasHeader React component, which serves as a header for a marketplace flow template. It displays the flow's name, a back navigation button, and a 'Use Template' button (conditional on permissions) to copy the flow data.

This file defines the Marketplace view component, responsible for displaying, searching, filtering, and managing available templates and custom templates. It allows users to browse different template categories, apply filters, switch between list and card views, and interact with template actions like sharing or deleting.

This file defines the `MarketplaceCanvas` component, which displays a read-only, interactive view of a marketplace chatflow using ReactFlow. It allows users to visualize and copy pre-defined flow templates.

This file defines the `MarketplaceCanvasNode` React component, which renders a visual representation of a node for display in a marketplace or canvas, including its icon, label, input/output handlers, and an interface for additional parameters.
